boardgame.name: Generic Lewd Digimon
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome, Jumper, to the World of Digimon! Well, not the “official” one, but some of the adjacent universes that spun off from the original ones. These are those worlds as envisioned by the lewd, the prurient, and the deviant, among some of my other favorite people. You’re going to the world of Digimon Pornography.

boardgame.name: Generic Lewd Pokémon Jump
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Pokémon! This world is inhabited by incredible creatures with amazing abilities called Pokémon! For some people, Pokémon are pets, others use them to fight, while a few study Pokémon as a profession.

...Of course, this particular world is far more sexual then ones that you might be more familiar with. Pokémon and humans are far more physically affectionate both with their partners and each other, battles have a tendency of devolving into hardcore fucking, and professors and their assistants run all sorts of lewd experiments on Pokémon and even people to fulfill their desire for perverted knowledge. Your very own Pokémon legend is about to unfold! A world of wet dreams and lewd adventures with Pokémon awaits! Let’s go!

boardgame.name: Lewd Shipgirls
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A variety of games exist where warships return in the form of cute and/or beautiful girls. These powerful and attractive young women are intensely loyal to the player character.

For some completely unexplained and mysterious reason, a lot of porn has been made about these games.

boardgame.name: Lexx
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

There are two universes. The Light Universe, home to the League of 20,000 Planets ruled over and protected by His Divine Shadow and the Divine Order who serve him. And the Dark Zone, the universe of chaos, depravity, and evil. At least if you believe the propaganda. In truth, there is darkness and light in both universes, though it’s mostly pretty dark overall.

boardgame.name: Monster Girl Encyclopedia Bonus Scenario Supplement
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Want even more extra CP, and maybe a few other prizes? Well, if you want, you can take one or more of these special challenges.

boardgame.name: Monster Girl Dreams
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Lucidia, an entire continent of beautiful vistas, labyrinth dungeons full of treasure, and monster girls chomping at the bit to get their hands on a man. You, a graduate from adventuring school, have arrived in this den of darkness to prove your worth, free yourself of debt, and maybe defeat the Demon Queen. There’s only one problem: physical violence is impossible anywhere in Lucidia, meaning you must get ‘physical’ with the monster girls in a different way to defeat them.

boardgame.name: Nyakumi
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The world of Nyakumi Neko’s 3D hentai videos. A very strange and sexy world that has humanity walking side by side with cat girls, androids, aliens, and elves, many of which have both pussies and cocks. In addition, a strange fog has descended on the world, in some places more than others, that slowly transforms woman and futas into sex-crazy amazons.

boardgame.name: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them: Attack of the Baby Koalas
boardgame.description: A 6 card expansion for The Dark and The Deep (12 cards total) that expands the game for 4-6 players. It consists of 4 0 point cards, 1 13 point card, and a new thing.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them
Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them: The Deep

boardgame.name: The World of Lolis
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Ah, somehow I'm not surprised that you ended up finding your way here. Where exactly is here, you may ask? We'll get to the specific details in just a moment, but know that you shall spend the next 10 years surrounded by lewd lolis and innocent imoutos, by lecherous louts and oblivious Onii-chans. For you are now entering a universe much like the ones seen in some of those perverted manga you refuse to admit that you ever even herd of. Welcome, Jumper.

boardgame.name: Tifa Lockhart - Agent of Avalanche
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Midgar, home to the cast of Final Fantasy 7, but not quite the same ones that you know and love. This is a much more perverse world based on several very lewd stories written by Damonisa, where the heroines have to fend for themselves in Midgar’s dark underbelly and often don’t quite manage it.

boardgame.name: Toshi Densetsu - Bitch or Urban Legend Slut
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

There’s all kinds of urban legends told throughout Japan, tales of strange entities, objects and events made to frighten anyone that hears them. But what if the subjects of those tales had more lewd intentions in mind instead of anything truly horrific? That’s the kind of world you will be experiencing for the next ten years, either as one of the so-called ‘victims’ or as one of the urban legends themselves.

boardgame.name: Ultra Body Mod
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Sometimes you just want to build the best body possible and you don't want to visit 100 jumps to get a single perk. Well then this supplement is for you then.

boardgame.name: 黒川おとぎ Kurokawa Otogi - Zakuro Shoukougun, or, Pomegranate Syndrome
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This world is almost identical to our own with a singular exception. Here, there are girls with skill and talent beyond belief. Girls who can make people cry with a single sonnet, or laugh themselves sick with a single joke. Girls who can cook food of such high quality that it becomes a religious experience and girls that can run ten miles in ten minutes. In return for their incredible ability, they suffer from Pomegranate Syndrome, and periodically turn into total sluts that pose a very real threat to others, especially boys. The only way they can return to normal is through sex, but by that point who knows how much damage they could cause.

boardgame.name: "Fellatrix" Jumpchain
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

There are infinite worlds in the multiverse which can be visited. Somewhere amongst them there is one based on the works of the artist “ Fellatrix ” and that is where you will be spending the next ten years.

boardgame.name: The Band Card Game
boardgame.description:
The Band is a card game easy to learn and fast to play. The goal of the game is to form your own band (singer, guitarist, bassist, drummer), but watch out for other players: they will have the same goal as you! Opponents will be able to get in your way with fierce Groupies, Producers ready for anything and unscrupulous Head Hunters. Don't worry, though: your Bodyguards will protect you from any malicious player.

Draw from the main deck and play as many cards as you want. The cards you play go into your personal discard pile, called the backstage pile. If you draw an event you skip the turn and suffer (or all players suffer) the effects of the event. Events discard onto a common discard pile and cannot be owned by players. You must have a maximum of 4 cards in your hand to end your turn. If you have more, you can discard the excess cards to the backstage (without using them) and pass the turn. The first to form a complete band wins!

boardgame.name: Maize Craze
boardgame.description:
In Maize Craze, players try to navigate various corn mazes. Each maze is composed of a pathway depicted by dice faces. All players simultaneously roll dice and try to place the dice as fast as they can to complete the maze shown on the card.

The first person to complete the maze, wins that card.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Findorff
boardgame.description:
Findorff is one of the 23 districts of Bremen, the hometown of Friedemann Friese. In addition to having three "F"s, Findorff is named after Jürgen Christian Findorff (1720-1792), who was responsible for draining and surveying the bog in the north of Bremen, for extracting the peat, and for populating the bog with residents.

In Findorff, the game, you build up the district of Findorff in the period from 1803 to 1916. During the first half of this period, peat is an important commodity for heating the houses and for supplying energy to the industry. In the late 19th century (and in the game), peat loses its importance once coal can offer a higher quality of heat.

During that period, six major railway stations are built in Findorff to connect to Hannover, Hamburg, Oldenburg, and Bremerhaven. While they are all later replaced by a single big main train station, another small railway is built to the bog in the north of Bremen, offering better transportation of the peat than with the boats on the canal.

Findorff offers an economic engine builder with a resource market for peat known from Power Grid and resource management required when building rail tracks and houses in the district of Findorff. The main part of the game are 25 tarot-sized cards that represent the main structures of Findorff. By raising these structures before the two main rail tracks are finished, you can claim the victory.

You start with different sets of the structure cards in hand and in a central market, with predetermined sets of cards for beginners and drafted sets for experts. The structures offer a very wide range of costs and therefore of benefits. In the end, all cards score the same amount of VPs.

The strategy in Findorff is to find the best way to play with your structure cards and to keep track of what others do. Try to raise the most structures, and if tied, have the most leftover cash and resources.

boardgame.name: FUSS
boardgame.description:
The nightmare of a few teenagers in a suburban housing estate comes true when on a weekday evening walk they see an alien spaceship landing at the end of their street. The kids have no idea what are the aliens up to but the situation seems to be serious, so they need to run away and it might be a good idea to warn the neighbours that something is going on! Players are moving on a board from point to point and try to avoid aliens who are after them, while they try to alert the residents.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Flute of Sailroc Edifiice
boardgame.description:
An entry in the tenfootpole Wavestone Keep contest!

From the publishers blurb:

Characters obtain a magical flute that causes a tower to sail on a rocky island from the ocean. There is a lot of filthy lucre inside, but much of it is bulky, brittle, puzzling, or dangerous. When the tower starts sailing off, the player characters will need to devise a plan to get the treasure out before the tower leaves for good.

boardgame.name: Unique Locations: Collection 03
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whether encountered on a quest, or simply found while traveling from here to there, feel free to add these unique locations to your next gaming session. Some are magical, most are mysterious, some are less-than-interesting.

Locations include:

A desert town where a bandit gang is after your MacGuffin
Blood seeping from the stones at the site of a holiday murder
Twisted trees and large mushrooms that hide creatures not of this plain
Stones ringing the top of a mound, their surfaces carved with glyphs and designs

boardgame.name: Vigilante
boardgame.description:
From the back of the envelope the booklet comes in:

1) This is not intended for the mentally unstable, for the easily offended, or for persons under 18. Please do not let it fall into their hands. If you think this warning is funny, by all means laugh your ass off, but we're serious.
(2) Likewise, if you are mentally unstable, easily offended, or under 18, please do not read the contents until you are older, more experienced, and/or recovered.
(3) If you think it would be funny to accidentally' leave the contents of this envelope where they might upset someone, ask yourself: "How funny would it be to have a SWAT team burst through my door and 'accidentally' fire several warning shots into my head and chest?"

The booklet comes in a yellow envelope.

boardgame.name: Hate
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hate is a very powerful supernal character for any version of the Black Monk.







In The Black Monk, the characters are people living in a desolate, but vibrant world where time seems to have lost meaning. Living for decades, perhaps longer, in isolation from others, the people of Elysia toil in work, only to be visited once a year by the Black Monk.
In between these visits, their lives are interrupted by sometimes trivial and other times confusing events. Everything seems to fit together like an elongated jigsaw puzzle, but no one can see the starter pieces stretching across the horizon.
But they don’t complain. There is always more work. The village needs workers.
Then one evening, the sun stayed in the sky all day. When there should have been night, the sun remained. And now it feels as though it’s been years since the Black Monk came. But perhaps it was yesterday. Nothing is right…
Is that blood?

boardgame.name: Sorrow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sorrow is a very powerful supernal character for any version of the Black Monk.







In The Black Monk, the characters are people living in a desolate, but vibrant world where time seems to have lost meaning. Living for decades, perhaps longer, in isolation from others, the people of Elysia toil in work, only to be visited once a year by the Black Monk.
In between these visits, their lives are interrupted by sometimes trivial and other times confusing events. Everything seems to fit together like an elongated jigsaw puzzle, but no one can see the starter pieces stretching across the horizon.
But they don’t complain. There is always more work. The village needs workers.
Then one evening, the sun stayed in the sky all day. When there should have been night, the sun remained. And now it feels as though it’s been years since the Black Monk came. But perhaps it was yesterday. Nothing is right…
Is that blood?

boardgame.name: Sans Pitié
boardgame.description:
A game in the tradition of Cards Against Humanity.
One player is the master of the round and reads out the text of a red card. All other players now each secretly select a black card. Those black cards are shuffled and read out as responses to the red card. The master of the round decides which response is funniest and the player who chose that card receives a point.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Corpus Angelus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

We are proud to present Corpus Angelus; a book filled with the stuff of heroes, with righteous stories of angels and the brave warriors, clerics, and soldiers that support them in their never-ending struggle to snuff out evil. In over 350 pages, this book contains a great deal of content and new rules of the righteous that can be used by players and Game Masters alike!

As a player, you can use this book to flesh out your heroes and thus your stories, using more than 30 archetypes, 6 races, over 100 spells and more; all of which this book provides and all of which shall help anyone with noble intentions on any endeavor they may uındertake.

As a Game Master, you can create more realistic characters with deeper motives using the system of devotions paths, find ways of bringing back the most lost of souls through the system of redemption, and find new ways to bring evil to its knees through the many more thrilling mechanics in the pages of this book!

Keep in mind, this book can be used for both evil and good campaigns. For it takes the purest of hearts to cleanse the most corrupt of souls, and the greatest heroes to defeat the most vile villains.

boardgame.name: The Saga (Apr 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Table of Contents
Strongholds: Adding a home to your tabletop game Page 4
Worldbuilding Interview: Christopher Burdett Page 10
Communication and Gaming Page 17
The Summoner’s Lair: A 2nd Level Adventure Page 20
Into the World: The Red Dagger Page 25

boardgame.name: Barbed Words
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Nabissum Priestesses from the Gurda Churral region are whispered about among the citizens of Tres. To cross one is considered a foolish and deadly gambit. The powers they wield tap into the fiendish planes, and they relish in showing this divinely constructed authority. Those unfortunate enough to find themselves facing their ire should consider their life forfeit.

Barbed Words is a Q-Encounter, or Quick-Encounter, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 12th-level characters. This encounter would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Parnan Castle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Parnan is the capital of Kom, the northernmost province of the Thardic Republic. The town is an important trade hub, headquarters of the Kom Legion, and traditional heart of the Ilviran faith in the region. Although centuries have passed since Parnan was first settled, its inhabitants still look with pride on the ancient hillfort their Komii ancestors built on this wind-swept shore of Lake Benath. The post of magistrate, the province’s top civil and judicial official, has been vacant since last year. Powerful clans now back rival candidates and seek to influence the decision of the Senate.

The Parnan Castle article describes the settlement's history, government, religion, economics, and military forces. It includes color GM and player maps of the settlement and brief descriptions of many local craftsmen and other locations. The article also features color floor plans of Caer Parnan, headquarters of the Kom Legion, and Parnan Palace, the center of the province's civil government.

boardgame.name: Laket Keep
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Laket is the westernmost keep in the Kingdom of Melderyn. It is primarily a frontier fort and center of administration for the borderland region known as Dyriamarch. The march is a vast area of wilderness that includes the southern Anadel Highlands and most of the woodland plain of Horadir, the range of the Hodiri tribesmen. The warden of the march, Sir Barryn Alaga, has only the most tenuous control over the region.

Laket is the last major settlement on the Genin Trail as it leaves Melderyn. The town bustles with traders and travelers throughout the year but sees a significant increase in activity in the spring and autumn when the large caravans to and from Tashal stop for provisions, repairs, or just a chance to rest and carouse before resuming their journey. Outside the small settled area around Laket, the wilderness presents varied and significant hazards. Other than miners’ paths, there are few trails north of the Horka and south of the Nuem River. The Bujoc, Hodiri, and Solori tribes, along with the Chindra and Moym gargun, make travel in the wilds particularly hazardous. Brave or foolhardy individuals planning to venture off the Genin Trail can usually find local guides and guards for hire in Laket.

The Laket article describes the settlement's history, government, religion, economics, and military forces. It includes color GM and player maps of the settlement and brief descriptions of many local craftsmen and other locations. The article also features color floor plans of Caer Laket, headquarters of the Dyriamarch Guard, as well as the home and shop of Jaket of Ekair, a merchant and moneylender with plenty of secrets.

boardgame.name: Queen Ezmeera
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Queen Ezmeera may be Vadashar's greatest thief: she is certainly it's longest working one, having over 50 years experience as a professional rogue. She is suspected of committing the Free City's largest heist, 40 years ago, but she's never confessed to it, then or now. At this point in her career what she cares most about is basking in the respect and reputation she's earned over a lifetime of crime—although a new bag of emeralds would be nice, too.

Included are adventure hooks, a brief history of the Free City of Vadashar, plus a description and stat block for Queen Ezmeera. There is also advice for incorporating Queen Ezmeera into your campaign.

boardgame.name: Attalis: Thief of Vadashar
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The master thief Attalis is a living legend among the criminal class of Vadashar. A skillful practitioner of thief-craft, Attalis is acknowledged by the notorious denizens of the Free City's underworld to be its uncrowned Prince of Thieves, planning several complex, celebrated heists that have become legendary. There are no limits to his larcenous creativity, or the means to which he will go in pursuit of a score.

Included are adventure hooks, a brief history of the Free City of Vadashar, and description and stat block for Attalis. There is also advice for incorporating Attalis into your campaign.

boardgame.name: Lady Belteshazzar
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mother of the Free City of Vadashar's ruler loves to acquire and use power. Manipulative, plotting, easily offended, and prone to holding lifetime grudges, she commands a secret cadre of aristocratic spies who are ready to do her bidding, and too terrified to fail her. And with a princely son who wishes she'd stay on her side of the castle—Lady Belteshazzar puts the "mother" in "smother."

Included is a brief history of the Free City of Vadashar, description and stat block for Lady Belteshazzar. There is also advice for incorporating Lady Belteshazzar into your campaign.

boardgame.name: Lore of the Giant Kings
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the misty prehistory of the Megacontinent of Zul, alien horrors terrorized the nascent mortal races, creating a living Hell on earth. Then came the Giant Kings, mythical god-heroes who overthrew the yoke of the cthonic horrors and ushered in a Golden Age. Lore of the Giant Kings pierces the veil of that distant time, to an era when Giants Walked The Earth of Zul, and a race of demigods taught humans, elves, and other races the earliest forms of magic and science.

Included is a brief history of the Free City of Vadashar, descriptions and advice for incorporating the myths of the Giant Kings into your campaign.

boardgame.name: Amric of Burgöthia
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hither comes Amric the Burgothian, ginger-haired, hawked-eyed, sword in hand, a thief, a reaver, a slayer, with gigantic melancholies and gigantic mirth, to tread the jeweled thrones of Zul under his booted feet. The next Sword and Sorcery NPC for our “Free City of Vadashar” line, Amric is a barbarian prince from the far north who has traveled the world's oceans, wastelands, and dark places in search of freedom and adventure. A strategist as well as tactician, he can be a sturdy ally or a fearsome foe for your PCs as they slink through the alleyways of the Free City.

Included is a brief history of the Free City of Vadashar, description and stat block of Amric of Burgothia. There is also advice for incorporating Amric into your campaign.

boardgame.name: The Calendar of Zul
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What do the stars hold for your adventuring party? The next entry in our “Free City of Vadashar” line expands the World of Zul into the very cosmos themselves. The Calendar and Zodiac of Zul features the almanac and astrological charts that have been employed since ancient times by the civilized peoples of the Megacontinent of Zul. Included is a list of month names (and their more familiar equivalents), as well as constellations, Zodiac signs, and a complete list of the major holidays and festivals celebrated since the fall of the Giant Kings.

boardgame.name: Lord Trimalkes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Our second entry in our “Free City of Vadashar” line. Lord Trimalkes is a fabulously wealthy NPC who owns much of the best real estate in the Free City of Vadashar, as well as its largest private library. He knows everyone in power, and they know him; the trouble is, they really can't stand the sight of him. Famed as a gourmand, and even more famed as an eccentric, he can serve as a potential patron, ally, or aggravation for your player characters.

Included is a brief history of the Free City of Vadashar, description and stat block of Lord Trimalkes. There is also advice for incorporating Lord Trimalkes into your campaign.

boardgame.name: Estet'ik
boardgame.description:
Install, overlay, turn to create a gallery of portraits. Noses, eyes, mouths, hair and moustaches ... a crazy Tangram to recreate a portrait gallery! Or create your own wacky portraits!

With over 150 colourful cut-out shapes, players can choose one of 3 different games that are suggested in the rulebook.


Recreate the portrait on the template card.
Make a fun portrait using the pieces shown on the card.
Select your own pieces and board and mix and match to make your own gallery of wacky portraits.


This components lend themselves to open-ended play.

—description from the back of the box

Released by Djeco as part of the éduludo line: "A recreational and educational collection to accompany your child in his or her first learning stages."

boardgame.name: The Beggar King & the Kingdom of Beggars
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Beggar King and the Kingdom of Beggars is our premier entry in our “Free City of Vadashar” line, and is an up-close and personal look at one of society’s most overlooked segments—and one of Vadashar’s most adaptable.

Included is a history of the Free City and its beggar population, descriptions and stat blocks of important members of the Beggar Kingdom, new magical items, adventure hooks, and more. There is also advice for incorporating the Kingdom of Beggars (and the city of Vadashar) into your campaign. The art captures life on (and under) the streets of Vadashar, a city of thieves, warriors, sorcerers, scoundrels, and characters with their own agendas. “The Beggar King and the Kingdom of Beggars” is just one layer of the deeper, darker secrets and stories yet to be told about the Free City.

boardgame.name: Cult of Athena
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mystery cults are secret societies that exist within religious institutions. Like other secret societies, their existence is well known, but their rituals, lore, and objectives are concealed. Only the initiated are allowed access to these secrets.

This file provides an overview of mystery cults and specific details about the Cult of Athena, one of the most important and powerful deities in the Amazons vs Valkyries setting.

Features:

Sample cult secrets
The location of Athena's main temples
Festivals held in Athena's honor
New Magic Item: The Aegis of Athena (replica)
New Artifact: the Aegis of Athena
Paladin's Oath of the Strategist

boardgame.name: Maladum: Dungeons of Enveron
boardgame.description:
Maladum is a fantasy miniatures board game in which you control a band of adventurers seeking their fortune in the ancient dungeons of Enveron. They must fight off the Revenant hordes as they search for valuable artefacts and negotiate with a varied cast of NPCs.

Maladum is built on the bestselling sci-fi game Core Space but has been overhauled and updated to accomodate the fantasy theme and rich lore. Like Core Space, Maladum takes place on a detailed 3D board of award-winning Battle Systems terrain, included in the box!

Your Adventurers will return to the town between games, where the exciting campaign system will track your party's fortunes, developing their skills, upgrading their equipment and telling their story.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: On Every Golden Scale
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The end of a war between two countries on a balkanized world rests on the shoulders of the PCs as they’re tapped to transport a peace offering to a neighboring state. But a simple Point A to Point B mission is complicated by the forbidding terrain, the ever-present threat of banditry, and the machinations of a shadowy figure who wants the carnage to continue for his own ends. And then there’s the nature of the tribute itself. It seems harmless enough, but is it really? And how long will the war continue should any harm come to it?

On Every Golden Scale is a short science fiction adventure using the Cepheus Engine, Cepheus Deluxe, and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game rules. Other 2D6 systems are easily adapted.

boardgame.name: The Incompleat Talamhur
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Herein you will find the Incompleat Talamhur -- two INCOMPLETE volumes of lore and rules for the World of Talamhur and the Land of Carregdubh, as well as two maps, one the 25 mile-per-hex map of Aentyr -- the region once ruled by the Tuatha De Danann, the other Carregdubh, Region 01 of the 25 Regions of Aentyr.

Volume one is the Incompleat Talamhur -- Carregdubh, Land of Black Stones. Originally designed to be a series of 25 booklets, the "Chronicles of Talamhur," the first one is incomplete, detailing portions of Carregdubh. Some areas are described in complete detail, others are skeletal, and still others merely have a hex number and a name.

The other volume is the Aentyr Cyclopedia, which was to include details on the races, pantheons, and other "high-level" information for the entirety of the 25 Regional maps. Also, again, incomplete.

boardgame.name: Psychic Class
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This booklet presents a new 15-level Psychic Class that utilizes psychic powers, completely compatible with the existing magic system!

The class possesses the following abilities:
Psychic Powers!
Psychic Combat!
Attune Restricted Magic Items!
Psychokinetic Powers!
Psychic Combat Expertise & Mastery!

The new Psychic class can be used alongside traditional magic-users and clerics or can take the place of one or both in a more science-fantasy campaign.

boardgame.name: Wicked Encounters #1: Slakt the Slayer and the Seven Dread Dwarves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 16-page booklet has a ready-made wicked encounter ready for the judge to use in the underworld or wilderness. It includes a party of eight villains of 5th to 9th level:

Slakt the Slayer, a mighty human warrior-mage – and his “uncles,” the Seven Dread Dwarves:

Ond the Evil, Pretender-in-Exile
Lur the Cunning; “Lur of the Lightning”
Stygg the Ugly
Skrekk the Hideous
Friendly Frykk
Foul Frekk
Skurk the Villainous

The eight are out to overthrow an ancient kingdom for their own wicked purposes. And your party might just be in their way…

Plus, two new magic-user spells and a new magic ring!

boardgame.name: Aki Akane
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Once upon a time, there was a girl by the name of Tatsuki Arisawa. She was a fighter, a tomboy, protective of her friends, and the second strongest girl in all of Japan. One day she noticed that a friend of hers, Orihime Inoue, was drifting away from her, speaking to her less and less, not showing up to school, and not even at home when Tatsuki went to check.

boardgame.name: Generic Norithics Jump
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hello there Jumper! This time you find yourself in a cartoony realm created by the artist known as Norithics Kusemurai. Of course, they don't really have much of a consistent setting outside of one ongoing storyline, but they do have plenty of recurring characters, plot-points, tropes and shenanigans going on that don't really conflict with one another, that might as well be considered a semi-coherent setting if you tilt your head and squint. This is but one of the places you might find yourself in this Jump! So whether it's the far-flung future of Partners volumes 1 and 2, or the “setting" implied by his various gags and recurring characters, your "adventures" for the next decade will be drawn from the art of Norithics.

boardgame.name: Generic Pirate
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Pirates! Scourges of the Seven Seas, dashing scoundrels living a life free from constraint or such petty concerns as ‘the law’, heroes and villains in more stories than can be recounted… well, you’ll be seeing a lot more of them, because you’re going to a setting that’s all about piracy and pirate-related shenanigans. What kind of piracy obviously depends on your choices, given that this is a ‘Generic’ jump.

boardgame.name: Generic Shota/Shota-con Jump
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are going to spend the next 10 years in a world with a lot more cute boys, and hot older women than usual.

boardgame.name: Generic Virgin Jump - Jumper the Virgin
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

So, you have been chosen to be a Jumper! Congratulations! This is going to be an amazing experience for you, assuming you can handle it. There is going to be struggle, suffering, hard work, and even danger in your future. And I am just talking about your personal life. But don’t worry, there is a way to make sure you are prepared. A way to help turn a virgin Jumper into a dynamo of excitement and adventure. A nice tutorial to the more intimate side of Jumpchain. You will spend one year in each of ten Levels before moving on to the next, each one designed to help prepare you for what is coming your way.

boardgame.name: Generic Loli Jump
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is you chance to become a little girl just like you have always wanted… or perhaps you just want to be inside one. Either way, this jump isn’t connected to any particular world, but can be used to play in one of several different worlds. Some of these worlds have stories that you can become part of for a reward, found in the scenarios section.

boardgame.name: Fate / Blacked
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Fate. To Stay Night, and Zero, and Strange Fake. To Tsukihime and Melty Blood. But mostly, welcome to Fate Grand Order. Though, perhaps Fate Blacked Order might be more appropriate? This jump primarily revolves around the organization known as Chaldea and it’s attempts to maintain and fix human history, but you are by no means limited to it’s antics, or even to a Grail War.

boardgame.name: Fate/Grand Master
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome back to Chaldea, traveller. If you’re familiar with the world of Fate/Grand Order then you already know something of what awaits you here: human history has been incinerated by the machinations of the King of Mages, leaving only the men and women of the Chaldea Security Organization left to oppose him. In another time and place it would’ve been a completely ordinary person who became the last master and led a team of servants to victory on mankind’s behalf, but here and now that’s no longer the case. For this isn’t the world of Fate/Grand Order but of the many depraved h-doujins based on it, from the Marked Girls series authored by Suga Hideo to the works of Asanagi and Bbsacon and many others like them. In these worlds the Last Master to whom this great responsibility falls turned out to be such a hopeless pervert that he even warped the rules of the FATE system to his benefit, but that perversion may be the very thing that humanity needs most.

boardgame.name: Fate / Horse Order - Class Bestiality and Related Works
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Though Chaldea exists outside of time, every year without fail it’s Master spends at least a week or two trapped on a beach somewhere. Sometimes it’s something they did on purpose, but oftentimes it isn’t. However, while the beach may be a somewhat relaxing vacation compared to their normal job, there is something occurring that makes these “vacations” somewhat unpleasant.

boardgame.name: Fate / Loli Order - Magical Girl F****** Marathon
Fate / Loli Order - Magical Girl Fucking Marathon
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the year 2015 the Organization for the Preservation of Human Order, Finis Chaldea, was destroyed. A traitor had placed a bomb inside their control room, killing 46 of the 48 master candidates, the director, and countless staff. Since then, Chaldea has been limping along, slowly fixing the eight singularities created by the traitor and his master in the wake of the attack.

boardgame.name: Fate / Whore Order - Chaldea Bitch
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Heroic Spirits are an existence above mortals, the men and women who shaped the oceans, built the mountains, who defined the concept of heroism with the mere fact of their existence. And as more than one legend will tell you, these men and women who are larger than life also have appetites that are larger than life. Case in point, Medb, who’s lust for men was so large that she was said to need seven men a day to satisfy her desires.... Or Fergus. That really tells you something about their stamina, doesn’t it?

boardgame.name: Gloschli
boardgame.description:
A card game in which players aim to get rid of as many creatures as possible or exchange them with an opponent's card.

The first player who manages to have five or less points in their cards triggers the last round by announcing "Gloschli". Their cards are now protected and can no longer be claimed by their opponents. After the other players have finished their last turn, all players turn their cards face up. Each player's total points are calculated. As soon as the first player exceeds 100 points, the game is over and the player with the fewest points wins.

boardgame.name: Fate / Worm Night - Kotori
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the years leading up to the Fourth Holy Grail War, Tokiomi Tohsaka had a difficult choice to make. For you see, he had two children, two wonderful daughters who were both acceptably talented in the arts of magecraft, Rin and Sakura. Normally this would not be much of a problem, but Tokiomi was a Magus. Only one child could inherit - the other was either useless, or a threat.

boardgame.name: Ashigei Shōjo Komurasan!
Ashigei Shoujo Komura-san
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Some stories are about incredible worlds. Some stories are about incredible people. Some stories are about regular people, in regular worlds, with very… irregular habits. Komurai Komura is a sweet and athletic girl, who just happens to descend from a long line of acrobats who passed down many eccentric traditions. Namely, from the day they are born, they train themselves to use their feet for absolutely all tasks. Really, the only role their arms serve is to support their weight during hand-stands. The result of this is an almost superhuman flexibility, balance, and overall athleticism.

boardgame.name: Bible Black
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

"This is the great Grimoire, containing the rarest secrets in the world. The great laws of magic. Here you shall find secrets chants for the Holy Spirits of the Darkness. The throne of the Apostles shall be assumed by the one who has been entrusted with the key to the Kingdom of Heaven, in the words of the Lord Jesus Christ to Saint Peter: 'I shall entrust thee with the key to the Kingdom of Heaven', and he alone shall have the power to command the Lord of Darkness and his servants. And they shall be his servants also and shall bring him honor and glory and worship. Again in accordance with the Lord Jesus Christ's words, 'Thou shalt serve only one God'. By the power of the key to the Church, thou shalt become the ruler of Hell."


~Preface of the Bible Black

boardgame.name: Ruins of Symbaroum Gamemaster's Screen
boardgame.description:
From the back of the bundle:

With the Ruins of Symbaroum game line, the acclaimed setting of Symbaroum comes to the world's most popular roleplaying game rules! This gamemaster's screen and adventure booklet will serve you and your friends well when you start exploring the game world, using the 5th Edition OGL ruleset!

The Ruins of Symbaroum Gamemaster's Screen provides easy access to important tables and information from the Player's Guide, Gamemaster's Guide and the 5th Edition OGL ruleset, including Marks of Corruption, Enemies in Davokar and a listing of various Conditions. The screen comes with a 29 page booklet featuring two adventures Where Darkness Dwells and The Gathering Storm, suitable for player characters of levels 2 to 4.

boardgame.name: Camp Petal for Gifted Girls
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Greetings, young woman, and welcome to Camp Petal, a fourteen week getaway for ladies of talent and skill to unlock their inner potential. Camp Petal gathers the most capable witches as Camp Counselors to teach young women how to harness their magical ability, and utilize it for means both practical and pleasurable. Camp Petal is filled with a variety of physical and magical activities for campers to do between lessons, challenging all to perform at their best. We are here to help you become the very best you can become, and give you the knowledge and tools to reach beyond even that.

boardgame.name: CHC ~ Iro ni Somerarete iku Gakuen ～色に染められていく学園～
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Mega W’s magical realm – a large, ordinary Japanese highschool with an even ratio of male and female students. Up until now, the worst thing to happen here has been some students violating the strict rules about personal appearance that are imposed by the education system. It’s not haunted, there are no super-powered battles in the halls, and there’s no secretive ninja cabal infiltrating it. Unfortunately for the students and faculty, though, the school infirmary gets its medicine from an irresponsible, drunken genius of a pharmacist who’s just made a breakthrough in her quest to develop a rapid-acting oral hair dye. Unfortunately for the world, the moment she cleared the animal trials for her drug she got extremely drunk and sent all four thousand bottles of her prototype Color Change (CHC for short) to the school you’ve found yourself in. She’s turned up to try and rectify the mistake by tracking the stuff down, even enlisting the help of one of the students in the process, but a pair of delinquents has already stumbled onto the full supply and decided to have fun with it by spreading it around.

boardgame.name: Corruption of Champions
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Centuries ago, a tribe of magic-blessed humans appeared in Mareth, building a home and eventual kingdom for themselves within the mountains. Talented at the arcane arts, they could manipulate the very fabric of reality itself with their magic, crafting whatever mundane item or object they so desired. Such a group would be peaceful, loving and happy with their lot, and indeed they might have been, were they not a large party of interdimensional explorers whose expedition became mired in Mareth. A quirk of Mareth’s nature prevented any known plane-shifting spell from transporting people off this world, instead forcing would-be travelers to rely on the many portals scattered across the world.

boardgame.name: Troop of Beasts
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Troop of Beasts, an erotic Dragon Ball fanfiction by Jeckjack. This world's history is the same as the canon until the arrival of Kakarot on Earth. You see, he never hurt his head in a way that would result in him developing into the kind-hearted Goku. Fortunately, Son Gohan was more than strong enough to fend off the wild child’s attempts on his life, and so the old man kept the latter contained within the mountain range that served as their home. Bulma managed to get the fourth-star dragon ball from Gohan, but her adventure stopped after she couldn’t find a way to bypass the Fire Mountain. With no hero around, the Red Ribbon Army grew in power until a resistance was formed to oppose them.

boardgame.name: Kyonyuu Fantasy 2
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome, Jumper, to fair Hillsland. Perhaps you have heard of this land before? Perhaps you have spent some time in the neighboring country of Edelland? No? Well, if you have you may be interested to know that you step into a land where humans and demons still live side by side, mostly. The great war that drove their population into the depths of Giripon Wood has not yet occurred. Indeed, a succubus currently holds the title of Duchess in the land of Molgrey. Otherwise, well, you should expect your fairly typical low-fantasy setting. And boobs, lots and lots of great, heaving bosoms.

boardgame.name: World of Lewd Elves
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Long ago this world was formed from the void by the efforts of a single goddess. However this goddess was not the benevolent and all loving creator god that many other worlds had, no this was the Goddess of pride, beauty, nature, and purity. Her intention in creating this world was to craft a race of perfect beings to worship her for all time. One long lived, beautiful, chaste, masters of whatever they choose to train in, and of course completely devoted to her, the elves. After she had crafted her precious children she also added other lesser races like orcs, monsters, and of course humans whose purpose in her world was to be enemies her children could easily defeat, proving their own superiority.

boardgame.name: Your Isekai - Yurisekai / World of Yuri
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

One day in 2018, two young girls were walking home from school. Isuzu Hino and Yuuri Kuroi. They were ordinary girls, with very little about them that made them stand out, that made them special. Well, other than the fact that both of them were doujinshi artists specializing in yuri works.

boardgame.name: Sailor Uranus
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome, traveler. Perhaps this world is familiar to you. A group of young Guardians wage war against the forces of evil and Chaos. Their souls tie them to Earth’s celestial siblings, the immense bodies who reside in the night sky: Luna, Jupiter, Mars… Surely you know. Peculiarly, this world seems to focus not on the protagonist of that story, but another member of the group. Haruka Tenou, the Sailor Guardian Uranus.

boardgame.name: Back Again from the Broken Land
boardgame.description:
From Kickstarter:

You are little people who walked into a big war. The Doomslord’s forces were gathered in the Broken Land, and your fellowship played a small but crucial role in their fall. Now, laden with stories to tell and burdens to bear, you set off on the journey home. But the Doomslord’s Hunters are still out there, and it’s a long way to walk…. Back again from the Broken Land.

❈ ❈ ❈ ❈ ❈

Back Again from the Broken Land is a tabletop roleplaying game of small adventurers sharing stories on a long walk home. It is meant to be played in one or two sessions. The game is inspired by the emotional, even bittersweet stretches of The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings.
boardgame.rpg: Back Again from the Broken Land

boardgame.name: Mind Control University
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Congratulations! You’ve received your acceptance letter to Hogwart's MCU!

This interdimensional institution is the premier academy for mind controllers the multiverse over. You will have around forty classmates, each with their own motives for attending, from wanting the power and resources the school can provide, to wanting to learn to control the minds of others, to wanting to be controlled, to just being unaware of the school’s nature. Classmates of your preferred gender(s) shall be quite attractive to you, and vice versa.

boardgame.name: My Little Pony Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

In the My Little Pony Roleplaying Game, players craft their own custom pony character to use in this storytelling game of friendship and magic, as they combat various Threats and other problems in Equestria and beyond! The Game Master can use pre-written adventures (in the Core Rulebook and supplements) or use adventure hooks presented in the book to create all new stories for the players to enjoy.

boardgame.name: My Little Pony Roleplaying Game Dice Set
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

This 8-piece dice set is what everypony needs to play the My Little Pony Roleplaying Game! The set includes a d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, two d20s, and a D2, a two-sided coin that has My Little Pony icons on each side., these dice will help you harness the magic of friendship with every roll!

boardgame.name: In a Jam Adventure and GM's Screen
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

In a Jam is a perfect follow-up adventure to the introductory adventure found in the My Little Pony Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook.

Features:


32 page booklet featuring the “In a Jam” adventure for 1st through 3rd level players
Beautiful My Little Pony artwork for the outer GM Screen panels
Reference tables and key rules to streamline gameplay inside GM Screen

boardgame.name: Dungeon Party: Starter Pack
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Party is a quick-play fantasy role-playing game played with coasters and a coin.

Dungeon Party is easy to learn, playable in a short time (or extended if that is desirable), has all of the aspects of a classic RPG adventure, and is playable in a bar, restaurant, or at home. The combat mechanism is fun and adds an element of luck and skill without much complexity. The game system is infinitely expandable.

Players will assemble a "dungeon" by creating a stack of coasters that includes rooms, monsters, and treasures. They then adventure through the dungeon by turning over tiles, battling the rooms, defeating the monsters, and looting the treasure. Along the way, they may pick up magical treasures or spells that can help them in their quest. If they survive the dungeon, the player with the most treasure points wins. If they do not, the dungeon wins. But either way, there will be laughs and maybe even a drink or two!

Battles are resolved by players trying to drop quarters on coasters. If they miss, players take hit damage. If they land on the coaster, the monsters take damage. Battles continue until either monster or player is eliminated.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Star Realms: Rise of Empire
boardgame.description:
Star Realms: Rise of Empire is a new standalone pre-quel to the popular Star Realm series game with 141 cards, and a 12-game legacy scenario campaign. Rise of Empire introduces three brand new factions: the Consortium, the Scavengers, and the Kingdom. Rise of Empire will take players on an epic adventure over the course of 12 scenarios where players will permanently alter the market deck cards while tracking their battle wins and losses. Players will compete to achieve various objectives, earning them Campaign Victory Points and unlocking the secrets of the worlds around them. Rise of Empire can be played stand-alone or combined with all previous Star Realms content after you’ve finished the campaign.

Features
12 Legacy Scenarios
9 Sticker Sheets
Starting decks for 2 players featuring 3 brand new factions
8+ Legacy Component Envelopes
Narrative Campaign for 2 players
Competitive and Cooperative mode
Plays on its own, or combined with any other Star Realms set.
An all-new 60-card trade deck featuring new mechanics like "when acquired" abilities!
Market/Campaign Board
Full-color rulebook

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Okko Oni Hunters: Oni Court
boardgame.description:
This expansion for Okko - oni Hunters greatly complicates the task of Okko and his companions. Can they accept the new challenge and save Pajan's empire from falling into the hands of the dark forces that covet it?
This expansion makes the final battle against the Oni richer and at times more difficult by introducing a variety of demonic creatures, each one different from the other.

boardgame.name: Okko Oni Hunters: Heroes' Inn
boardgame.description:
This expansion for Okko Oni Hunters allows you to diversify the enemies encountered during the journey of the group of adventurers, to make the acquaintance of the great elemental masters but also to grant your heroes well-deserved rests at crucial stages of their journey!
This expansion, in addition to its 2 new heroes, brings many welcome advantages to the adventurers, but be careful not to overdo it or you'll get bad karma.

boardgame.name: Drugs/Alcohol: Play It Straight
boardgame.description:
Drugs/Alcohol Play it Straight Game is very educational for Red Ribbon Week or Alcohol Prevention Program


Use this during Red Ribbon Week and provide a wide variety of activities that can be used with children and adults. Players move around the board by the "safe" or the "risk" path and must look at options, make decisions, and answer questions about drugs and alcohol. It's packed with hard-hitting information and thought-provoking real-life and imaginary situations. 2-5 players. Grades 2-Adult. Please check our more Red Ribbon Week items on our website!

boardgame.name: Okko Oni Hunters: Pajan War
boardgame.description:
This expansion for Okko Oni Hunters takes into account the Pajan War taking place as Okko and his companions travel the roads of the empire. The conquests of the various great families will, of course, have consequences for our heroes' adventurers!
This expansion expands the adventurers' horizons and they will see that everywhere in the Pajan Empire, the evil threat of the Onis lurks.

boardgame.name: Common Decency
boardgame.description:
Scandalise your friends, startle your colleagues and unnerve your casual acquaintances with this irreverent party game!

Read a card aloud and on the count of three, everyone points to the person most likely to answer yes to that question. If everyone guesses right, dispose of the question card. If everyone guesses wrong, gain another question card. The goal is to get rid of all of your question cards, or have the least at the end of the game.

boardgame.name: Hatterasopoly
boardgame.description: A custom board game, similar to Monopoly, but based on Hatteras, NC.

boardgame.name: The Grund Operations Manual
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grund, a venerable Kharadron Arkanaut Ironclad sky-ship captained by the stalwart Brokka Brokkisdotr, takes to the skies in search of adventure and profitable ventures. Yet the skies of the Mortal Realms are far from safe…

The renowned sky-vessel The Grund has featured in a number of Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Soulbound adventures, such as Crash & Burn, Faltering Light, and Cities in Flame. The Grund Operations Manual gives GMs and players information on The Grund and her crew, and contains everything you need to make The Grund an integral part of your adventures — or even a home base for your realm-trotting games of Soulbound. Whether you’re a GM or a Player, The Grund Operations Manual is your ticket to airborne excitement.

The Grund Operations Manual contains:

A detailed battle map and stat block for The Grund itself.
Stat blocks, background, and unique plot hooks for each member of the crew.
A whole host of upgrades from devastating weapons to eccentric endrinworks to install on The Grund or other Kharadron sky-ships..
Endeavours for The Grund and her crew to undertake during downtime, such as Aether-gold Prospecting and Cargo-hauling.
Minor and Major random encounter tables to bring your airborne adventures to life.

boardgame.name: The Book of Random Tables: Quests 3
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cut down your game master prep with 1000 fantasy adventure ideas
Like the first two books in the series, this book is meant to help the dungeon masters and game masters of fantasy tabletop role-playing games save time. Preparing RPG campaigns and sessions can be taxing, and sometimes a spark is needed to light the creative fires.

DMs and GMs always need clever hooks and stories to launch their players on fantastic adventures. These quest and adventure ideas can be used in a couple of different ways.

First, they can be used as the main objective of a campaign. Second, they can be used as side quests or rumors during a larger campaign. To help use the ideas in either of these ways, the quests range from simple to complex. This range gives DMs flexibility in crafting sessions.

The adventure ideas have been arranged in random tables so dungeon masters can roll percentile dice to discover quests. The element of randomness in tabletop RPGs often brings out the most fascinating and engaging stories. As game masters and players add to the seed provided, unique tales emerge.

The quests are categorized by different themes: Apocalyptic, Espionage, Fey, Gnome, Maps, Messages, Quest Givers, Ranger, Sky, and Thieves Guild.

Death and destruction reign in the Apocalyptic section. Gear up for spy action with the Espionage quests. Journey in the fair country with ideas in the Fey table. Spent some time with the little folk exploring the Gnome quests.

In the Maps table, game masters can give their players a unique map that leads to high adventure. The Messages section provides special deliveries for hints and clues characters need.

People need jobs done and one hundred of those people are found in the Quest Givers section. Rangers got to range with the variety of quests on the next table. Take to the skies with Sky quests. Get sneaky with quests suited for the Thieves Guild.

With these one thousand adventure ideas, you will never have a lull at the gaming table. Flip to any page, roll your dice and get ready for adventures you and your players will never forget.

boardgame.name: Wilderness Dressing: Woodlands (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of glossing over the details of your characters’ overland journey (except for the inevitable, violent random encounters)? Want to add minor features of interest to their journeys? Want to make their journeys seem more “real”?

Then Wilderness Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different type of wilderness and gives you--the busy GM--the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features, events and encounters. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, it is an invaluable addition to your GM's toolbox!

Wilderness Dressing: Woodlands presents:

Minor Events: One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your characters’ wilderness travel.
Minor Dressings: One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
Uneventful Day's Travel: One table (20 entries) presenting descriptions of uneventful days on the road.
Campsites: One table (20 entries) presenting campsites to add details to your characters' overnight wilderness trips.
Random Encounters: One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.

boardgame.name: Glittering Caverns
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quick micro dungeons - Small, quick dungeons for OSR and 5e games.

Intended to be run in one adventuring night, Quick Micro Dungeons are a DM's best friend.

The Eighth installment involves an old dwarven mining operation in a fantastical cave that sparkles in the night horizon.

boardgame.name: Dust Fiend
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here comes double trouble! The dreaded dust fiend is here, and whether it roams the wastes as a wild predator or serves it's bunker dwelling human creators as a patrol beast, it's always a brutal, close-quarters killer.

Able to crab walk back and forth or side to side, climb over the roughest terrain or climb up the face of a ruined skyscraper, these powerful muties are a serious challenge to any excavation team that finds itself in the arid badlands and dunes of the Mutant Epoch era. In melee range fights, they are at their most devastating, and with two heads and the exceptional alertness this offers, they are hard to sneak up on or catch in the open where ranged attacks are a dig teams only hope. Worse, they are known to roam in packs of up to six members, and mount merciless ambushes on those who foolishly enter their territory.

boardgame.name: Cult of Heimdall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This file provides an overview of mystery cults and specific details about the Cult of Athena, one of the most important and powerful deities in the Amazons vs Valkyries setting.

Features:

Sample cult secrets
Places where Heimdall is worshiped
Ceremonies honoring Heimdall
New Spell: Night Watch
Paladin's Oath of the Watcher

boardgame.name: Armada: Magic Deck
boardgame.description: These optional rules and cards for Armada will add a sparkle of magic to your flee with a new Magic Phase and a new layer of tactics and excitement. Contains spell-books for Basilean, Orc, Dwarf, Empire of Dust and Kingdoms of Men Fleets.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Armada: The Game of Epic Naval Warfare Rulebook

boardgame.name: Ruins of Symbaroum Base Setting Books
boardgame.description:
This is a slip case containing the Player's Guide, Gamemaster's Guide and Bestiary for Ruins of Symbaroum.

From the back of the books:

With the Ruins of Symbaroum game line, the acclaimed setting of Symbaroum comes to the world's most popular roleplaying game rules! This gamemaster's screen and adventure booklet will serve you and your friends well when you start exploring the game world, using the 5th Edition OGL ruleset!

The Ruins of Symbaroum Gamemaster's Screen provides easy access to important tables and information from the Player's Guide, Gamemaster's Guide and the 5th Edition OGL ruleset, including Marks of Corruption, Enemies in Davokar and a listing of various Conditions. The screen comes with a 29 page booklet featuring two adventures Where Darkness Dwells and The Gathering Storm, suitable for player characters of levels 2 to 4.

boardgame.name: Septima
boardgame.description:
Only in a few corners of the world is the memory of magic still alive, even though a few centuries ago its healing power permeated everything. Witches, its last remaining practitioners, have always been outcasts and could help human society only in strict secrecy. The leader of their people, the Septima, has always been the wisest, most knowledgeable witch. Now, as her time is coming to an end, witches from all over the world gather at Noctenburg to leave their mark on the hostile town and prove to the Septima that they are her worthy successor.

Septima is a competitive, highly interactive strategy game of witchcraft. As the leader of your coven, you must prove your worth in the town of Noctenburg to become the successor of Septima, the High Witch. Practice your craft and gain Wisdom by collecting herbs, brewing potions, healing the townsfolk, mastering charms and rescuing your fellow brothers and sisters from the trials. But beware: magic, even if used for good, invokes suspicion in the townsfolk...

Simultaneous action selection with positive player interaction: Septima’s central mechanism revolves around the simultaneous, secret selection of one of nine Action cards each turn: Move, Collect, Brew, Heal, Recruit, Plea, Chant, Rite and Remember. Each Action gets a powerful bonus if it is chosen by multiple players, but performing them together also raises suspicion in the townsfolk and attracts the attention of the Witch Hunters. Decisions of when to do a shared action (and who to do it with) adds a fresh, semi-cooperative touch to a competitive game, and lots of player interaction.

Rescue witches to build your Coven: Heal, enthrall or convince the townsfolk and amass enough support to sway the periodic Witch Trials in your favor. If the hostile witnesses are outvoted, the convicted witch is absolved and joins the coven that rescued them. You start small but you can grow your coven to up to four witches this way, each with their own personality and special ability to help your cause. Reckless Witches caught by Witch Hunters are also put to trial, so with enough support from the townsfolk, even witches from other, less careful players’ coven can end up in yours.

Accessible, intuitive and familiar: Septima is Mindclash Games’ most accessible title to date, with beautiful, hand-drawn art style by Villő Farkas and with the character art of Barbara Bernát, wooden components and intuitive, theme-inspired mechanisms. It is very quick to teach and set up, and takes less than 2 hours to play, even with four players.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Talisman: Harry Potter – 2022 Promo Card Set
boardgame.description:
A pack of 2 promo cards for Talisman: Harry Potter to go with the 2022 localisation of the game into Italian and Polish.

Bezoar - Outer Ring Encounter Card

Felix Felicis - Middle Ring Encounter Card

Note: The pack will be available separately as well.

boardgame.name: Kings of War: War in the Holds 2 Player Starter Set
boardgame.description:
This starter set contains two starter armies for Kings of War - The Tabletop Game of Fantasy Battles.

The set contains 44 Goblin and 42 Ratkin miniatures, a softback rulebook with army lists for 14 factions, plus a getting started booklet to help you with your first games.

boardgame.name: Split
boardgame.description:
Family card game where players place a card between two numbered discard piles. The card placed must be a number between the two cards on the discard piles, and the next player will decide which direction to move the center card, creating a new number gap in which to play their own card. Numbered wilds can be played at any time and will be moved over to one of the discard piles by the next player. When a player can't play they reset. To reset, a player will discard all of the cards on the table, draw 3 new cards into their hand, and play the highest and lowest card out of their hands to start the new discard piles. You cannot go out on a wild and the first player to get rid of all of their cards wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Share and Sparkle Unicorns
boardgame.description:
Preschool cooperative game where players are all trying to fill their unicorn's crown and necklace with gems, before the troll fills his bag with gems. Players roll and blindly take gems out of the bag and place any that match openings on their unicorn board. Any that can't be played are given to the troll. Any red gems will go straight to the trolls bag and a red gem token is drawn that will either be good for the unicorns or good for the troll. Players can also roll to share the gem they draw and they'll share all the gems they draw once they finish their unicorn. Play until all of the unicorns have all of their gems or the troll has filled his sack with gems.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Highlights: Hidden Pictures – Flashlight Search Game
boardgame.description:
Team up and work together to search for 150 things to find in this nighttime carnival scene loaded with surprises. Use your Flashlight wand to make the scene on the game board magically appear, and hunt for cleverly hidden things to find on a game board measuring over 3 feet long. Look carefully, because all objects are cleverly disguised in a variety of Hidden Pictures ways. The trickier the search, the more points you can score. Race to be the first team to find enough things to score the most points and win!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: QE: Commodities
boardgame.description:
Q.E. Commodities now presents new investment opportunities for each country! As an expansion to Q.E., you will now have the ability to diversify your portfolio by investing in gold, oil, and crypto. Each commodity adds additional variable victory points to bolster your score. The biggest element of the expansion however is that it now enables you to lower your total spend throughout the game, providing extra layers of strategy and unexpected twists!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Forest Sky
boardgame.description:
Crows, hawks, eagles and owls wheel and whirl above the forest. The constant motion highlights the shifting balance of power that determines who really rules these skies.

Forest Sky is an 18-card hand management game where 2-4 players compete for the best 6-card scoring combination. Each card features a unique scoring rule, with players using both the 3 cards in their hand (“the sky”) and one of the shared card pools in play (“the “forest”) for final scoring. As players draw cards, they’ll fill the forests and shape the skies in their favor to win the game.

boardgame.name: Baby Boomer Bingo
boardgame.description:
A boomer comment is read and all players decide which of their cards is the best younger generation response -- as well as the one that will benefit their bingo card the most. When the best response is chosen, that becomes the bingo call! Cross off the matching boomer/color combo on your bingo board if you have it. First to get a bingo wins -- but doesn't everyone win when you have a good laugh?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Haramase Simulator
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

March 07, 2018

After a massive terrorist attack on US soil, the president led America into yet another war. Other nations followed suit, each to protect their own interests, and soon, World War 3.1 was beginning. Mankind stood at the brink of nuclear annihilation as the world’s most powerful countries pointed their weapons at each other.

boardgame.name: スフィリアの使い魔 Sphilia's Familiar
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hundreds of years ago, the Demon Lord roamed free, terrorizing the world, indulging himself in senseless destruction and raping every beautiful woman he would come across. Backed by his powerful Demon Army, and supported by his four loyal demons - The Elite Four, nothing could stand in his way.

boardgame.name: Feisty Dice
boardgame.description:
A roll and write game where players are trying to be the first to fill in their colored dry-erase boards. Roll your dice and decide what to keep and what to re-roll. After 2 rolls decide which dice to score on your board; you can choose all dice of one color or exactly one of each color. Then keep any dice showing your color and yellow, all other players grab dice showing their color, and there are any dice left pass those to the player on your left and it's their turn. Use special "spit fire" power two times during the game to score twice on your turn. No reading required to play this family-friendly game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: I'm in Another World, so I Guess I'll Use Magic to be Lewd!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A young boy, summoned to another world for the purpose of defeating the demon lord, used all of the power at his disposal for the sake of that world.

boardgame.name: On Tour: Paris and New York
boardgame.description:
On Tour Paris & New York is a brand-new standalone game based on the original On Tour design and featuring some new opportunities for travel!

Your goal is to plot the longest and most efficient route through these two magnificent cities where you are musicians in the 1920's trying to play in as many jazz clubs as possible. Each turn two ten-sided dice are rolled to make two two-digit numbers that determine where you visit (a roll of 3 and 7 creates the numbers 37 and 73). All players write each of those numbers in a state on their map. The regions they can write in are restricted by cards turned up in the middle of the table.

New abilities to take riverboats and ferries will help you tour the city and become a jazz legend.

At the end of the game, each player draws a route on their map, starting with a low number and visiting adjacent states with higher and higher numbers. Players get a point for every venue they visit.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Shinmai Maou no Testament
テスタメント新妹魔王の契約者 The Testament of Sister New Devil
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Shinmai Maou no Testament , a light novel series by Tetsuto Uesu. At first glance this world may resemble the modern one you know, but peer beneath the surface and you’ll find a hidden history of gods, devils, and heroes lurking in the shadows. Human heroes have waged a shadow war against demonic invasion for centuries while the gods callously use humanity as a shield against their foes. But a generation ago this war was brought to a sudden and unexpected end by the efforts of the newly-crowned Demon Lord Wilbert, who negotiated a truce and withdrew all of his forces from Earth.

boardgame.name: KarenVania
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You know the story of Dracula and the Belmonts. With the Lord of Shadows ever returning, and the vampire killers ever standing in his way. Eventually, a true and final death will await him, a grand battle held just prior to the turn of the millennium. But this is not that story. Nor, it seems, is it a story in which the Belmont will even be appearing. Not even one of their many offshoots or side families. No, instead the investigation of the unusual activity in Castlevania will be held by a young elven girl by the name of Karen.

boardgame.name: Bites: New Recipes
boardgame.description:
Bites: New Recipes adds exciting game changing possibilities to the core game of Bites. One of the things that made the original game so exciting and replayable were the variable scoring cards.

This expansion takes them to an entirely different level. You'll be able to play with over a dozen new rule cards that have noticeably larger effects than the cards in the base game. In addition to the rule cards, you'll have new characters and objects to play with. With this expansion, it can feel like you are playing a completely different game!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Ranma Fall - Katamimi Buta
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of the Ranma series by Katamimi Buta. This jump mostly takes place after Ranma gets cursed but before he/she meets the Tendo family. A couple seem to be after. You will start not long after Ranma has been cursed. Maybe you can help Ranma or take advantage of before anyone else can?

boardgame.name: Erona ~ The Fall of a Beautiful Knight Cursed with the Lewd Mark of an Orc
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In a lewd fantasy world like many others, the routine extermination of a group of orc pillagers goes wrong and the leader, a knight prodigy named Claudia is forced to do countless degenerate acts in order to keep the lives of her comrades safe. However, the leader of the orcs, a mutant named Geldro, who unlike his brethren is both intelligent and a skilled magic user, has placed a curse seal upon her that will rob her of her skill as a warrior and her will to resist the pleasure.

boardgame.name: Scoops Meow
boardgame.description:
Scoops Meow is the purrfect flavor-matching ice cream game. Reveal a cone card and quickly memorize the flavors and toppings. Then be the quickest to find your matching ice cream and wafer cards. If you think you've got it right, place your face down cards in front of you. IF you're the first, grab a cherry and put it on top of your cards. Once everyone is done reveal and everyone who is correct grabs a cherry. If the player who was first was correct, they also get to keep their bonus cherry. First player to reach 7 or more cherries will win the game!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: North Idaho-opoly
boardgame.description:
An unofficial Monopoly-style game featuring Idaho Panhandle lakes, state parks, outdoor recreation destinations, and a couple mines and fairs, as properties, and similar topics on random event cards.

The remainder of the game's not specific to Idaho in any way - metal playing pieces (a hand, a smile, a heart, a dog, a pretzel, and a shoe), green and red plastic houses and hotels, and "dollars" for keeping track of how long you must suffer.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company

boardgame.name: JK Taimabu, or, Exorcism Club for Black-haired Girls with Ponytails
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Let me bid you welcome to Earth, jumper. At first glance, this is the same kind of 21st century Earth you might be familiar with already, but if one delves deeper, you will find out that monsters and demons of all kinds exist in the underbelly of society. Not very deep, and worryingly common, there’s only one thing between the monsters lurking in the shadows and the innocent civilians: The exorcists.

boardgame.name: Kabuto Sumo: Total Mayhem
boardgame.description:
Kabuto Sumo: Total Mayhem is an expansion to the base game Kabuto Sumo.

This expansion provides all wrestlers with a variety of what pro-wrestlers call "foreign objects". Each of these objects - think ladders, chairs, coffins - are put into play both in and around the sumo ring to enhance the wild physics of all the different shapes that psuh each other around! Plus, each object introduces new victory conditions that can expedite the game and add more strategic depth.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Taimanin: Gatchaverse
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the near future Earth has become plagued with demons from the dark world. While in the past these demons were more cautious about arriving in earth, the plans of the Demon Lords, as well as the corruption and hunger for power of various human factions and mass usage of dark technologies have driven demons to arrive upon earth in unprecedented numbers forming various factions all competing with one another for the domination of earth and humanity.

boardgame.name: Keep It Clean
boardgame.description:
A player reads seemingly dirty clues to the group and like "Full Service" or "Hot and Ready" and players have only a quick flip of the timer to come up with something that fits that description that is NOT dirty. Only squeaky clean answers will score.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Breathless Wild Jumpchain
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

One hundred years ago Calamity Ganon returned from his long slumber to destroy Hyrule and was met by Princess Zelda and her five Champions. But unlike another story which you may already know, in this world Princess Zelda successfully awoke her divine magic at the last possible moment and protected the majority of Hyrule from Ganon’s onslaught, though nearly at the cost of her life.
