In her absence Link and the Master Sword sealed the Calamity inside of Hyrule Castle, and he and the other four Champions gave their lives to safeguard Hyrule from Ganon’s armies and buy time for Zelda’s return.

boardgame.name: The Legend of Zelda - Alternate Destinies
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Ding dong the witch is dead! And by witch, I of course mean the evil king, Ganondorf. The Hero of Time, Link, has slain him and rescued the princess. Everybody lives happily ever after, and then we do this song and dance all over again in a few thousand years. Hyrule is just a tad bit depressing like that.

boardgame.name: The Great Cooper's Hill Cheese Roll
boardgame.description:
The Great Coopers Hill Cheese Roll is a fast racing game of chasing a roll of cheese down a hill, based on the very real activity of doing the same. Participants are racing to be the first ones to reach the bottom hill. Alternatively, players can attempt to catch the 9-pound double Gloucester cheese as they race down the hill to be instantly victorious.

Cooper's Hill is a write and roll game where layers simultaneously will write a number between 1 and 20 and then reveal at the same time. Writing the highest number will grant the player with the fastest speed but will also make them more likely to take a injury. Based on the number you wrote and how you move on the hill you will roll dice indicating what kind of injuries you sustain.

Attempt to push you luck just enough to avoid being eliminated while still reaching the bottom the fastest.

boardgame.name: Taimanin!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is a world of darkness. Where once there were rules of non-interference between humans and demons in ancient times. But now through the evil and greed that rests in human hearts those rules have been eroded and criminals consort with the forces of darkness. Demons can now walk openly among humans and civilization’s morals are being corrupted. However not all is lost as there are those who still walk the path of righteousness. In Japan those are the forces of the Taimanin, a government backed group of anti-demon ninjas.

boardgame.name: Smash Bros XXXTreme
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It’s Super Smash Bros, but not quite the way you’ve seen it before. Maybe it’s a special after hours relaxation battle, or maybe it’s their day off and their making use of some… less well known rule sets. Either way, the ladies of the Smash Bros cast have started a sex battle between themselves. What’s the prize for winning?

boardgame.name: Pokémon Ecchi
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Midara Region. You can reach it by taking a boat or plane from the northern parts of Sinnoh. It’s only been settled for 200 years, so while humanity has carved out some portions of the land for themselves, much of it remains wild and untamed. Law enforcement is essentially non-existent beyond “might-makes-right”, so there are some criminals that take advantage of its lawless nature. In addition, for unknown reasons, Pokémon are much more sexually aggressive here, which has lead to an increase in Pokémon-human sexual relations, even if they aren’t quite “acceptable” yet.

boardgame.name: Pigskin Football
boardgame.description:
The wildest, grittiest & most extreme 2 player football board game that plays in an hour. Pigskin uses a combination of set collection, dice rolling, action selection & hand management to bring a fresh and fun way to play out a 2-player game of American football.

Pigskin has all the stats of an actual football game baked into the mechanics, including penalties, completions, yards gained, sacks, turnovers and scoring to bring you the most realistic football board game on the market that plays in about an hour.

The game uses a "mean, muscular pig player" theme with fabulous artwork on the cards as well as a beautifully designed board (football field) to really allow players to get immersed into the excitement.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Submission Sailor Moon Jumpchain
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Black Dog’s Submission Sailor Moon h-doujin series. It’s been a pretty wild time to be living in this world’s Japan for the last few years. Tokyo has been invaded by monsters every year like clockwork since about 1995, and every year the Sailor Senshi beat them back and restore peace to the world. But the likes of Queen Beryl and Sailor Galaxia have come and gone and these days the only threats our heroines face are leftover youma, mere table scraps from previous battles.

boardgame.name: Elzikyuchi's D********
Elzikyuchi's Dickgirls
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

By all accounts the world is Earth, early 21st century. But there are things happening that seem a little unusual. An odd virus sends women into heat. A secret corporation tricks women into signing off on extremely unethical operations in the name of marriage counseling. And a police organization from the future arranges for men to get raped in the ass in moments of frozen time.

boardgame.name: Hentai Island Survival
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This island you have found yourself on is very mysterious, filled with cryptids, strange plants, lizard people, the undead, and more… and all of them won’t hesitate to use your body for their own ends.

boardgame.name: Hypno App Fantasia
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Demon King has been vanquished, the Heroine and her party victorious at last. The monster threat that has been poised to make humanity and the other humanoid races extinct is rapidly fading from the world. It’s a time of light and laughter, a new age of hope for all. But all so boringly vanilla.

boardgame.name: Naruto Blacked
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Elemental Nations, traveller. You probably know these lands for their famous ninja, or at least for their gifted warriors who call themselves ninja. These ninja and the nations they serve come from many clans and cultures, but in this world one stands out from the rest.

boardgame.name: Emergence
ShindoL's Emergence
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Pretty similar to where you came from, huh? The world of Earth, 2013. Cities are bustling, people are living, business is booming and the world is slowly dying. Not really any different, really. This world, when you look beneath the surface, seems to be darker and really rather grim. People rarely meet happy fates, relationships don’t end well, good people don’t get to lead good lives. But for the nasty guys that take advantage of others, this place might as well be a dirty little heaven all for them

boardgame.name: Silver Comics
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This story mainly takes place in a world of Pokémon, though our hero is not of this world a genetic experiment stumbling through a glass full of nanobots and running through a familiar looking portal starts her journey and is promptly attacked by a wild Pokémon. She is then rescued by a Lugia who then proceeds to have his way with her too, then something strange happens when they kiss the nanites activate and change her body, now no longer a feline/human mix, she transformed into a human/Lugia mix. They then get together and have many adventures.

boardgame.name: Spire's End: Hildegard – Bows and Breakfast
boardgame.description:
Bows & Breakfast is a small, non-essential pack of 10 extra Cards that provide a touch of variety to Spire's End: Hildegard. It consists of:

2 Instruction Cards
4 Story Cards for Chapter 1
4 Story Cards for Chapter 4

boardgame.name: Magic: The Gathering – Kaldheim
boardgame.description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering takes place on Kaldheim, an icy world (or rather, cluster of ten worlds) inspired by Norse Mythology. Kaldheim consists of ten realms: Bretagard, home of the human clans; Istfell, home to the spirits of the dead; Karfell, home of the undead draugr; Immersturm, home of the demonic hordes; Gnottvold, home of the trolls; Starnheim, home of the valkyries; Surtland, home of the giants; Skemfar, home of the elves; Axgard, home of the dwarves; and Littjara, home of shapeshifters.

New mechanics in the set include foretell, which allows spells to be placed on layaway for later, and boast, which allows creatures to activate a special ability on any turn where they attack. Also included are several returning mechanics: modal double-faced cards (originally introduced in Zendikar Rising), changeling (originally introduced in Lorwyn), sagas (originally introduced in Dominaria), snow-covered lands (originally introduced in Ice Age), and snow mana (originally introduced in Coldsnap).

The set is sold in draft boosters, set boosters, collector boosters, theme boosters, and bundles, and it contains 285 cards (121 commons, 80 uncommons, 64 rares, 20 mythic rares, and 10 snow-covered basic lands). An additional 15 uncommons and 5 rares are found only in set boosters and theme boosters. The main set is also accompanied by two preconstructed commander decks that tie into its themes.

boardgame.name: Color in Light
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Underneath the blue skies and bright yellow sun, a colorless village can be found. Music and color are lost in a small village near Kryptgarden forest and characters must travel to the Feywild to find answers.

A Two to Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8

CONTENT WARNING: Grief, trauma, loss
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Two to Tengu
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A real misty mountain trip- travel into the feywild domain of Korama, meet with its eclectic lord, and explore the mountainside home of a tengu archfey. Drama! Romance! Intrigue! GOOD FOOD! Korama has it all! And a "kid" who is trying their best to be as chaotic as possible, whom the lord is desperately in need of mellowing out.

A 4 hour Tier 1 adventure for inquisitive souls balanced for 5 characters of level 3

Warning: Contains Wasps.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: The Rookery: Rise of the Everplume
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The perimeter of a volcanic island needs secured!

Help a nature preserve's new caretaker assure the area surrounding his base of operations is safe.
The Rookery is a magical tome containing a feywild demiplane dedicated to the preservation and rehabilitation of endangered species. The land inside consists of several islands containing
diverse habitats such that any creature needing care had terrain similar to home. Once the species recovered or flourished, they were reintroduced to their native plane.

Unfortunately, before the domain truly flourished, the book along with an entire Fey queen’s library was banned and then lost. It was ultimately forgotten, and the land within it left to its own devices for many hundreds of years. As time passed, the original monitoring facilities became a forgotten ruin on a distant island.

The domain has recently been reclaimed and a new caretaker is rebuilding the former Visitor's Center. Now he needs help securing the rest of the island on which it resides, so he can start investigating the long lost domain.

The party will need to deal with a wild beast, assess an active volcano, locate a lost village, and uncover a terrible story.

This is designed as APL 3, but contains adjustment information to run at any level within Tier 1.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Trust No One
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part Two of The Sanguineous Gambit Trilogy

Having learned of the approach of the Thayan army, a party of adventurers races to alert the city of Derlusk and its ruling body, the Coinseats Council. When they arrive, enemies hide around every corner. Who can be trusted?

A Four-Hour to Six-Hour Adventure for Characters of 5th – 10th Level

boardgame.name: The Black Lily Contract
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mwynhad, the famous Feywild resort, offers off site excursions to the Morlyndu Lagoon.

Now, dangerous events threaten the weekly trips.

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3. Complete with maps and Universal VTT files.

While this is a sequel to WBW--DC--TLRMB-02: The Last Resort, but it can be played as a standalone adventure. DMs can also use this in their home brew.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Jenga Maker
boardgame.description:
Work together without letting your builds topple!
One teammate gives directions while the other builds. Crown your build before the other team can finish theirs! The first team to take the crown in three rounds, wins!

In Jenga Maker, teams race to build objects blindly. One teammate describes how to assemble an object from a card image, and the others rush to assemble it and crown their creation! But watch out -- if you build an object wrong, your team loses the round! The first team to crown three builds, win!

boardgame.name: Killer Fish: The Role-Playing Game
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Role-Playing Game of Mutated Fish out For Revenge

You've never seen anything like Killer Fish before.

It's a tabletop role-playing game where the players take on the role of mutant fish, ready for revenge against their corporate overlords. Play with 2 or more friends, one acting as the Game Host. Can your School of Fishy Freedom Fighters defeat Evil Corp?

boardgame.name: Game Host's Guidebookmark!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Game Host's Guidebookmark expands upon the core game with . . .


A foe ranking system that makes mass battles quick and easy;
A simple way to judge the quality of Success and severity of Failure;
Guidelines for awarding and using Boons; and
Advice for creating adventures and enriching play!

boardgame.name: Player's Handbookmark!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Player's Handbookmark enriches play with...


Experience rules to add "Features" that expand campaign play;
Guidelines and examples for role-playing your hero's Vocation, Attributes, and Boons to best effect; and
A new battle tactic for characters to protect their companions in the heat of combat!

boardgame.name: Supers!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Don your costume, thwart a crime, protect your secret identity. Or stalk the grim streets of a noir setting, as someone blessed and cursed by abnormal powers. This sourcebookmark adds a d20 “Supers Die” to your repertoire, lifting your hero above the abilities of normal citizens, while also maintaining a balance between powers and vulnerabilities.

boardgame.name: Anno Domini 1666: Octavia
boardgame.description: Octavia is a 28mm metal miniature from the Hot & Dangerous range that is not only a collector item, but also a playable model in Anno Domini 1666. She is a mercenary character available to most factions. In addition to her miniature, she comes with a character card and four equipment cards.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Quest: Cursed City – Morrvahl Olbrecht
boardgame.description:
A character card for the ruthless wizard Morrvahl Olbrecht that was included with hardback and Limited Edition copies of the Cursed City tie-in novel from the Black Library. The card gives players the option to add Morrvahl Olbrecht to the pool of heroes available to undertake quests in Ulfenkarn.

Morrvahl plays quite differently from other characters in the game, possessing an attack that can damage friend and foe alike.

Players will need to provide their own miniature to represent Morrvahl on the board and he is specifically patterned after a model that can be built from the Cities of Sigmar Collegiate Arcane Mystic Battle Wizards box.

boardgame.name: Ready To Ride
boardgame.description:
Ready to Ride is a fast-paced and addictive card game for 2-5 players, in which you play skateboarders racing through the city streets at full speed.

The goal? Earn the most points by performing as many sequences of figures as spectacular as they are dangerous.

So, ready to hit the ramp?

boardgame.name: Troll Noir
boardgame.description:
Publisher´s Blurb:

LISTEN KID, I AM NOT SURE WHAT YOU WANT ME TO SAY.

IT IS A DARK, GRIM, GRITTY, DRITTY LITTLE WORLD OUT THERE AND SOMEONE HAS TO PROTECT HUMANITY FROM THE SICK DEPRAVITY OF BLINS... AND ALL THE OTHER THINGS THAT GO BUMP IN THE NIGHT.

YOU THINK I WANT THIS? YOU THINK I WANT TO PROTECT THIS CITY? NO... I HAVE DREAMS. SETTLING DOWN UNDER A NICE LITTLE BRIDGE, A BUNCH OF TROLLINGS PLAYING IN THE WATER... A POT OF WARM FONDUE BUBBLING ON THE FIRE...

BUT I DON'T GET THE DREAM KID. CAUSE I HAVE TO PROTECT THIS WORLD... CAUSE IF A TROLL AIN'T GONNA DO IT, WHO IS?

I'M GOING TO LEVEL WITH YOU. THE BOOK AIN'T MY LIFE STORY, BUT YOU CAN GET A TASTE OF WHAT IT IS LIKE BEING ME. TROLL NOIR CONTAINS:

SETTING INFORMATION
ALL THE MECHANICS YOU NEED TO PLAY
HANDY LITTLE P.I. CARDS TO GET YOU STARTED.
IT'S 26 A6 SIZED PAGES AND BLACK & WHITE

The print version was only available through the Angry Hamster Webstore/at the Angry Hamster booth at several cons/fairs (e.g. Spiel 2021)

boardgame.name: Rapscallion - Ashcan Edition
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This ashcan edition features everything you need to play a game of Rapscallion while it is still in development.

6" x 9" Softcover Book

Black & White Interior

6 Playbooks + GM Materials

The Royal Navy has been hot on your trail for weeks. The Pirate Kings want your head after you pulled off a heist that.. ahem, relieved them of a sizable amount of treasure. You know you should feel worried, but all you see—looking out across the deck of your ship—is the vast blue ocean. The salt air brushes against your face, softer than any lover you’ve ever had. You can’t imagine feeling more free.

Your crew might be a strange group—and you can’t say that you trust them completely—but at a moment’s notice they’re ready to sail through monster-infested waters or scale a corrupt noble’s castle walls. Pirates, through and through. Each of them ready for anything.

And you’ve got secrets of your own! Perhaps you are an escaped noble, fleeing from the burden of responsibilities. Or maybe a mechanical construct, given life by a cruel master. Either way, it’s fair to say that the night-black void orb you acquired at the last port may have an effect on your health.

No matter. There’s adventures to be had and treasure to plunder. Sail on, me ‘earties! Yo ho!

Rapscallion is a tabletop roleplaying game in which you play a rambunctious crew of pirates, testing their luck against the unpredictable winds of Fate.

boardgame.name: Novi 1799
boardgame.description:
This game depicts the bloody and furious battle of the 2nd Coalition war that (temporarily) resulted in the loss of french dominion in northern Italy.

Each game box includes:
 One game-map,
2 sheets of counters and markers,
3 Player Aid Cards,
a rule booklet,
an historical commentary.

The scale is 1 hour per turn, about 500 m. per hex,
Each strength point (SP) stands for  50-150 men for infantry
and cavalry (basing on their efficiency rating), and 3-5 guns.
Designer: Enrico Acerbi
Complexity: 3/5
Solitaire suitability: 4/5

boardgame.name: The Thing: Token Set 1
boardgame.description:
A plastic set of 36 plexiglass tokens which substitute Leader, Freezing, Power, Contagion, and Dog infection tokens.

Contents:
24 Contagion tokens
9 Dog Infection tokens
1 Bottle Leader token
1 Freezing token
1 Power Failure token

boardgame.name: The Thing: Tokens Set 2
boardgame.description:
A plastic set of 60 plexiglass tokens which substitute Lab and Damage tokens.

Contents:
40 Lab tokens
20 Damage tokens

boardgame.name: The Thing: Special Weather Dice
boardgame.description: A special weather dice which glows in the dark!

boardgame.name: The Thing: Playmat
boardgame.description: A big neoprene playmat for your games (100 x 60 cm)!

boardgame.name: Anachrony: Resin + Heat Transfer Pack
boardgame.description:
A Resin Tile-set for Anachrony, replacing the cardboard Paradox tokens, warp tiles, and the Morale and Time Travel tracker markers for the base game and the Fractures of Time expansion.

Includes:


55 high-quality printed plastic Warp Tiles
12 plastic paradox tiles
4-4 resin morale and time travel markers

boardgame.name: Moonflower
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The Garden was once a wasteland of stone and iron.
Long ago, mysterious beings called the Gardeners have brought back a verdant world.
They ask all who are born to tend to this place, giving them a gift of a seed in a moonbeam.
This is the Moonflower, which we tend with tears and laughter.
Some winters ago, a strange flower began to bloom.
Enraptured by the Blueflower's saccharine scent and powers, people have lost their way.
A shade of blue washes over the Garden.
But your Moonflower still lives.

Publisher Blurb:

moonflower: a story game of impossible journeys is a tabletop role-playing game, oriented for one-shots without preparations. It does not require a facilitator and roles traditionally given to the "Game Master" are distributed across players and game mechanisms. It uses its own reading of tarot cards to guide the story.

In a moonflower story, the players will take on a journey toward the Moon, in order to seek help from the Gardeners who tend to the world. An unnatural blue flower is spreading across the Garden and, soon, all peoples will meld into pleasant and meaningless eternities.

It is heavily inspired by other games like Polaris by P. H. Lee and The Quiet Year by Avery Alder. The focus is on the characters’ decisions and choices instead of their accomplishments and victories.

boardgame.name: Menagerie of Magical Beasts
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Come one, come all, to the Menagerie of Magical Beasts - where you'll be wowed by creatures blessed with the fearsome power of the elements! Will you discover the dark secrets of the Menagerie as its host goes missing? And what will you do when the fate of these creatures is in your hands and your hands alone? Find out now in Menagerie of Magical Beasts!

Menagerie of Magical Beasts is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 8th to 12th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 10.

boardgame.name: Winter's Silence
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Betrayal is part of the game.

The client claims to be a mythical figure of legend, exiled from his body, inhabiting that of another until he can regain his sanctum sanctorum. Whether you believe him or not, he’s got gold and he seems ready to spend it. You know it means trouble, insinuating yourself into the world of the guilds and their wealthy members, but trouble is always part of the bargain. And the client’s story is only the tip of a very cold and very dark iceberg.

Winter’s Silence is a 52-page PDF adventure for Sword Noir: A Role-Playing Game of Hardboiled Sword & Sorcery (Second Edition) with 6 pre-generated characters for use by the players. While the adventure does not require the use of Sword Noir, the narrative characters and some situations are based on that system and would require modification to use with another.

boardgame.name: LUCANUS
boardgame.description:
You command an army of stag beetles. They are fighting each other on a cloven oak tree. The winner takes the ultimate delicacy – the oozing sap. The rules are simple, yet the tactical and strategic approaches are nearly endless. The goal is to get three of your stag beetles to the opponent's front row first. To get there, you'll need to push the enemy bugs off onto other branches, crush them, and drop them from the tree.

The game is played on a 10 x 10 square board. You can use two or three beetles to displace one or two enemy beetles in columns and in rows. But watch out! Diagonal push moves are mandatory. Even if you don’t like the direction! It will often be convenient for you to let your opponent push your stag beetles out during the game as this will weaken their position. And you can use these weaknesses to your advantage.

Some weaknesses can become strengths during the game. It works both ways. In the beginning of a game, it is generally good to keep a lot of stag beetles in diagonals. However, the more you move into your opponent's territory, the more you must be vigilant that they don't take advantage of your diagonals. For instance, they could place their beetles behind yours just to make you push them towards your front row.

A popular tactic is to sacrifice some of your stag beetles by letting them fall off the tree or be crushed. This destabilizes your opponent's position, and you can easily sneak this move in. You can also let your opponent reach your first row with two of their beetles. By doing this, you gain a positional advantage. You can quickly place three of your beetles on the enemy's first rowg and win. The game is very dynamic. A position that may seem wrong can quickly turn everything around and let you win. You just need to find the right way.

boardgame.name: Signs of Life
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Talamor Consortium has placed scientists in a domed research facility on a vacuum world in their control. It is a recently acquired planet and competitors have wondered why for some time. The world has no known mineral or research value Suddenly this station has gone silent. The consortium is offering a significant amount of money for a mission to find out what has happened and to rescue any living scientists still on the base.

boardgame.name: Lady Thistleton's Scandal Sheet
boardgame.description:
This supplement adds scandal sheet rules to Good Society for those who enjoy Bridgerton (and those who simply enjoy scandal).

Rumour and scandal is part of every game of Good Society, but what if the person spreading those rumours was one of the ton’s foremost? These rules add Lady Thistleton’s Scandal Sheet to your game, making the rumour and scandal phase even more… well… scandalous.

At the end of the game your group will secretly vote to decide which character was actually Lady Thistleton this whole time. How outrageous!

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: Good Society: A Jane Austen Role-Playing Game

boardgame.name: Conquering Heroes: Pregenerated Characters (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Eight PF2 heroes ready to conquer the world!

Conquering Heroes is the first in a new series of pregenerated Pathfinder Second Edition characters designed around specific campaign themes. Within these pages you'll find 8 fully fleshed-out, ready-to-play ideal for any campaign delving into the wooded wilderness, where barbarians and bandits lurk under the eaves of the fey forests and in the hollows of the empty hills, but where a hero might carve out not just a legend by a kingdom and crown of her own! Superstar author Neil Spicer proudly presents:

Arkadyus Sakharov, human bastard ranger
Davor Hestruk, half-orc fanatic cleric of the God of Battle
Faunlara "Faun" Daedys, elven treespeaker druid
Hulgrim Underspool, gnome prankster sorcerer
Pollyna Shuryon, changeling bandit rogue
Pyotr Maartis, human gentleman swashbuckler
Quinry Kimm, half-elven courtier bard
and last but not least, the enigmatic Radomir Lytkin, human student wizard
Each character includes a richly detailed backstory, roleplaying tips, special equipment, and a special campaign trait to help tie them to the background of the campaign, but while each is as much about story as combat, when it’s time to thrown down, none of these heroes will be stepping to the sidelines. Each character also has specific level advancement information for their first few levels, with further suggestions for developing the character's long-term mechanical build. We haven't even mentioned the fantastic old-school character portraits courtesy of Hugo Solis and Liz Courts, or the included foldable paper miniatures for every character!

boardgame.name: April Fool's Special 2022 - Puppy Swarm
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Give your party cuteness overload with this extremely cute and cuddly 'monster'. While one puppy alone can comletely derail a conversation or even cause a person to stop in their tracks to watch, enthralled, for minutes on end, a whole pack (or swarm) of puppies can do nigh immeasurable damage.

boardgame.name: Magma Core Undead
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Originally created by a powerful necromancer with a propensity for arson, magma core undead are the product of a unique ritual. This ritual requires the caster to magically place a core of magma inside the corpse they wish to raise as an undead. If successful, the process amplifies the normal necromantic rituals for the creation of undead, resulting in a creature that burns with the life of the molten earth itself.

This PDF contains a new undead monster template and the lore behind its origin, the stats for two such creatures, the magma core skeleton and magma core zombie, and the spell used to create them.

boardgame.name: Research Station Names
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not every station is a general commerce station. Some are dedicated to science and you have to come up with its name. d66 Research Station Names helps you by providing you with 36 unique names for places to explore the boundaries of science. Have the perfect name for your next game.

14 Antares Observation Station
33 Katherine Johnson Institute of Astrogation
66 Webb Observation Post

boardgame.name: Ways Your Rival Tries to Interfere
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rivals want to see you fail and you need creative ways to make them do just that. Don't get stuck in a rut. Grab yourself d66 Ways Your Rival Tries to Interfere and come up with something new and fun today.
16 Encased your ship in a self-hardening fire suppressant
26 Hired a robotic mariachi band to follow you around for a day
41 Paid a firm to wreck your reputation, giving your crew negative reviews

boardgame.name: Ship Systems Needing Maintained
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Things break on a ship. Parts wear out. Systems show signs of prolonged use. d66 Ship Systems Needing Maintained describes what and how is breaking down on your ship. Give your players something new that needs fixing today.

15 Auto-repair system not responding
21 Cargo doors require a swift kick to open
56 Targeting system randomly missing

boardgame.name: Les Mille pas
boardgame.description:
In Les Mille pas you play women in their professional lives. But this life is not a long, quiet road! Who will manage to beat the red lights and make a thousand steps?

A professional career is all about personal choices, decisions made by others, meetings, allies... In this game, you will have to find the right balance between blocking your opponents by distributing pitfalls symbolised by red lights, and helping them by finding solutions symbolised by green lights. The game tries to synthesise and make you live the adventure of a professional career between individuality and sisterhood. Throughout the game, players place step cards. The first player to accumulate 1000 steps wins the game!

Les Mille pas was created thanks to the testimonies of 700 women interviewed in 2020 about the obstacles and accelerators they encountered during their professional career. They also gave us their solutions for dealing with these inequalities. Les Mille pas is a reflection of these testimonies.'

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Glamour
boardgame.description:
Goal!
Here’s the deal. You’re in charge of a small group of Fairies trying to gain the favor of powerful people in the Fae Courts. Your goal is to use your Fairy Cards (your player hand) to manipulate Dram (the little chips, basically bidding coins) to buy Court Cards (point cards). You’ll have to use all your cunning, guile, and smooth-talkery to get the cards you need! The first player to get a Fae from all 4 Seasonal Courts wins!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Rise of the Ice Dragons Trilogy
boardgame.description:
Rise of the Ice Dragons Trilogy is a series of three adventures for the world’s greatest roleplaying game (5e).
It is designed for a group of three to five 7 to 9th-level characters, but includes scalable encounters to suit any level from 1-20.
The adventures can be played as a sequel to Secrets of the Drow, but can also be played separately and are easily adaptable to any campaign.

You have agreed to help the dwarven scholar Bjorn Amberclan to find three magical orbstones near Northwind Gate.

But others are searching for the legendary orbstones, too.
The evil ice dragon Isdrekin Nixius wants to use them to summon the rest of his kin and enslave everyone in Eastern Farraway.

You must find the three orbstones before they fall into the wrong hands – or the ice dragons will rise again.

Pack your sword. Bring your spellbook. Pray to your gods.
Let the adventures begin!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Prophecy of Nine Omens Trilogy
boardgame.description:
The Prophecy of Nine Omens Trilogy is a series of three adventures for the world’s greatest roleplaying game (5e). It is designed for a group of three to five 10 to 12th-level characters, but includes scalable encounters to suit any level from 1-20. The adventures can be played as a sequel to Rise of the Ice Dragons, but can also be played separately and are easily adaptable to any campaign.

The Prophecy of Nine Omens has foretold that three legendary orbstones will cause death and destruction throughout Eastern Farraway. The orbstones must be destroyed to avert the prophecy and stop the cataclysm.

You have to cunningly steal the orbs from a heavily protected vault and transport them across the sea to the secret location of the sunken city of Sirenholm. Only there, in the heart of the underwater Temple of Tanaaris, can the orbstones be obliterated.

Gather your companions. Bring your swords. Choose your spells wisely. Are you ready to save Eastern Farraway?

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Secrets of the Drow Trilogy
boardgame.description:
Secrets of the Drow Trilogy contains three dangerous dark elf adventures for the fifth edition of the world’s largest roleplaying game. The adventures are designed for characters of level 4 to 6, but include scalable encounters to suit any level from 1 to 20.

The isolated mountain town of Winterhold is under threat.
Dark elves are raiding nearby villages, burning farms, and kidnapping innocents.

But why have the attacks increased so dramatically? And how come the devious drow are always one step ahead of the game?

Deep in the caverns below Winterhold, the leader of the dark elves, Shade Drez’lyn, weaves a web of nefarious plans and plots. Her mysterious goal is soon within reach.
And unless she is stopped, it will be the end of Winterhold.

~ Sharpen your blades. Nock your arrows. Ready your spells. ~
Are you the heroes Winterhold have been waiting for?

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Before the Stroke of Midnight
boardgame.description:
Before the Stroke of Midnight is a Dungeons & Dragons 5th edition adventure by Midnight Tower.

It is designed for a group of three to five 9th-level characters, but includes scalable encounters to suit any level from 1-20. There are also pre-generated characters available for the game.

This adventure is a murder mystery adventure inspired by Edgar Allan Poe and can be used in any campaign or as a side-quest adventure.

Some towns and events used in this adventure mean that it works particularly well if played after the Rise of the Ice Dragons Trilogy adventures, but it can easily be adapted to suit other settings.

The Duchess Rose Blackraven of Shieldsborg Castle is dead. However, her last will is missing, and it is unclear who will inherit from her.

You must find the will before midnight and identify the true heir to Shieldsborg Castle. Search the old castle for clues, interview the secretive residents, and investigate the mysterious surrounding areas.

But be careful – more blood will be spilled, and a new murder will occur before midnight.

Eerie ghosts, mysterious intrigues, and dark secrets await you at the castle.

Look for clues. Sharpen your wits. Search the castle. Can you solve the murder before it is too late?

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Terrinoth Treasures: Volume III
boardgame.description:
Magical treasures are of course the most coveted and eagerly sought rewards an adventurer can hope to find. This third volume in this series of supplements provides fifteen (15) additional Terrinoth magic items (specifically 15 new Runebound Shards). Each is derived from previous lore in the Terrinoth setting (such as Runebound and Descent and even a Rune from the Legacy of Dragonholt), but now with new art and rules adapted for the Genesys Roleplaying System.

This is volume III of more such volumes to follow, as more items are adapted for the system. Each additional volume will feature 15 additional items and contain the same level of detailed information. Each item is illustrated and given details for play in the Genesys RPG system. This product can be used without having volume I or II, and is independent of these products.

Developed by veteran GM and self-described Terrinoth researcher Chris Markham, this is the one of over a dozen supplements for the Realms of Terrinoth setting. Though this supplement is set in the world of Mennara, it can be converted for use in your own fantasy world. The Genesys Core Rulebook, Realms of Terrinoth setting, and either Genesys Dice or the Genesys Dice App are required to use this product.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Terrinoth Treasures: Volume IV
boardgame.description:
More magical items! This fourth volume of the supplement provides twenty (20) additional Terrinoth magic items. Each is derived from classic magical items in various other fantasy roleplaying games. Like previous volumes, this product describes each item along with an illustration, rules for using it in Genesys, and the information needed for player characters to craft their own (if the GM allows it).

In addition, the components to make these items can serve as Adventure Seeds and provide tools for the GM to motivate and challenge players in making these items. This product can be used without having volume I, but the first volume does list additional crafting rules.

Developed by veteran GM and self-described Terrinoth researcher Chris Markham, this is just one of many supplements for the Realms of Terrinoth setting. Though this supplement is set in the world of Mennara, it can be converted for use in your own fantasy world. The Genesys Core Rulebook, Realms of Terrinoth setting, and either Genesys Dice or the Genesys Dice App are required to use this product.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Terrinoth Treasures: Volume V
boardgame.description:
Volume V in the Terrinoth Treasures series features (15) magic items exclusively derived from the Descent boardgame and expansions. As with other volumes in the series, each item is illustrated along with optional rules for players to create the items.

The exotic components of these items can even serve as adventure seeds as adventurers seek out dragon scales, rare gems, ogre's blood, or other exotic components needed to enchant these items.

Developed by veteran GM Chris Markham (as Gazrok Games), this is one of many titles already released for the Foundry and for the Terrinoth setting. Though this supplement is set in the world of Mennara, it can be converted for use in your own fantasy world. The Genesys Core Rulebook, Realms of Terrinoth sourcebook, and either Genesys Dice or the Genesys Dice App are required to use this product.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Terrinoth Treasures: Volume VI
boardgame.description:
More magical items! This sixth volume of the supplement provides twenty (20) additional Terrinoth magic items. Each is derived from magical items in Runebound, Descent, or various other fantasy roleplaying games. Like previous volumes, this product describes each item along with an illustration, rules for using it in Genesys, and the information needed for player characters to craft their own (if the GM allows it).

In addition, the components to make these items can serve as Adventure Seeds and provide tools for the GM to motivate and challenge players in making these items. This product can be used without having volume I, but the first volume does list additional crafting rules.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Terrinoth Treasures: Volume VII
boardgame.description:
More magical items! This seventh volume of the supplement provides twenty-two (22) additional Terrinoth magic items. Each is inspired by magical items from Runebound, Descent, or various other fantasy roleplaying games. Like previous volumes, this product describes each item along with an illustration, rules for using it in Genesys, and the information needed for player characters to craft their own (if the GM allows it).

In addition, the components to make these items can serve as Adventure Seeds and provide tools for the GM to motivate and challenge players in making these items. Additional Adventure Seeds are also offered. This product can be used without having volume I, but the first volume does list additional crafting rules.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Dead Theorists: A Card Game for Disillusioned Philosophers and Aspiring Academics
boardgame.description:
In this turn-based card game, the ghosts of Simone De Beauvoir, W.E.B. Du Bois, Michel Foucault, and Karl Marx have returned from beyond the grave to complete a bit of unfinished business. Become the specter of one of these four great (but deceased) thinkers as you seek to recruit your last great protégé from the ranks of students on one college campus. But you’ve encountered two challenges you didn’t expect: First, the forces of neoliberalism have been hard at work dismantling the education system. It will be tough to train your final pupil from within today’s profit-oriented university. Second, you’ve got competition! Other spirits have also awoken and they’re dead set on halting your progress and advancing their own ghostly agendas. Can you train your protégé in order to complete your unfinished business — and be the first one to do it? Satirical, educational, and a ton of fun for battle-hardened academics and philosophical novices alike. Includes 81 cards and the rules in an attractive box set.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Red Masks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part Three of The Sanguineous Gambit Trilogy

Having descended upon the Border Kingdoms, a merciless Thayan army marches toward the great
port city of Derlusk. Unfortified, the city mobilizes its meagre forces in a desperate attempt to stall the invaders long enough for civilians to evacuate.

Can a group of adventurers on a daring secret mission turn the tide of war?

A Four-Hour to Six-Hour Adventure for Characters of 5th – 10th Level

boardgame.name: Autumn Burns Red
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part One of The Sanguineous Gambit Trilogy

A welcome respite at the annual Harvesttide Festival suddenly becomes the backdrop of incursion of an otherworldly army! The people of Splondar call for anyone to save them from the destructive wake of this aberrant legion’s march! Why are they here? or better yet- Who leads them? Who has the courage to find out and warn the cities of The Border Kingdoms?

A Four to Six Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

boardgame.name: Dark Side of the Rune
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Heroes face an outsider enemy in a Far Realms keep. The portals attaching it to both the Far Realm and the Jundarwood Forest are the only things continuing to cause danger to the people of the Border Kingdoms. Can you take down the portals and make your way home safely?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 4 Characters. Optimized for APL 18.

boardgame.name: Beyond the Starry Veil
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part Three of The Shattered Stone Trilogy

Heroes completed a ritual to save Yallash and send Kethendyr back to the Far Realm, but it was not without a cost and mysterious forces lurk in the starry veil seeking a way to return to the Material Plane.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 3 Characters. Optimized for APL 13.

boardgame.name: The City in the Mist
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part One of The Shattered Stone Trilogy

Citizens of the coastal city of Yallasch are fleeing their home in terror. Rumors of unspeakable horrors residing in the city travel across the Border Kingdoms. Lord Iraun, a powerful and tyrannical ruler, calls to adventurers to aid him in restoring the city, raising suspicions about his true motives. What mysterious force is responsible for these reality bending events?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 3 Characters. Optimized for APL 13.

boardgame.name: Beyond This Portal
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A call was put out by the protector spirit of the Jundarwood Forest. Will you answer the call to investigate the corruption growing deep within the woods? Can you root out the evil before it takes hold and threatens the Border Kingdoms, even Toril as a whole?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 4 Characters. Optimized for APL 18.

boardgame.name: Far in the Forest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part Two of The Shattered Stone Trilogy

With the true villain responsible for the horror at Yallasch identified, the heroes uncover and perform a ritual, hoping to banish the city of Kethendyr back to the Far Realm and restore the city of Yallasch.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 3 Characters. Optimized for APL 13.

boardgame.name: Adventurers League Forgotten Realms DM's Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This document is a guide to getting started Dungeon Mastering games within the D&D Adventurers League, an official organized play program for Dungeons & Dragons.
...
This document covers Dungeon Mastering D&D Adventurers League adventures set in the Forgotten Realms, which includes all Adventurers League adventures except those from Eberron: Oracle of War (EB series) and Ravenloft: Mist Hunters (RMH series). Those storylines have their own rules for character creation and advancement.

boardgame.name: Adventurers League Forgotten Realms Player's Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This document provides you with the rules for creating and advancing characters within the D&D Adventurers League, an official organized play program for Dungeons & Dragons.
...
This document covers participation in D&D Adventurers League adventures set in the Forgotten Realms, which includes all Adventurers League adventures except those from Eberron: Oracle of War (EB series) and Ravenloft: Mist Hunters (RMH series). Those storylines have their own rules for character creation and advancement.

boardgame.name: Adventurers League Forgotten Realms FAQ
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The D&D Adventurers League is official organized play for Dungeons & Dragons and uses the fifth edition rules. For the most part, this document concerns itself with the Forgotten Realms campaign, which encompasses most of the adventures and play for the D&D Adventurers League.

boardgame.name: My Life With Maid RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a 24-page zine that gets into Maid: The Role-Playing Game, a tabletop RPG about anime maids that somehow became the first Japanese TTRPG to ever come out in English.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: U.S. Stamps Edition
boardgame.description:
Celebrate a historical hobby enjoyed by philatelists around the world with a custom collection you can take out and play!

Created in collaboration with USPS, MONOPOLY: U.S. Stamps Edition lets players buy, sell, and trade the most memorable stamps from U.S. history!

Six USPS-inspired tokens will keep players connected to their trusty means of communication, such as a Mail Truck, Mail Box, Package, Postcard, Coil of Stamps, and USPS Eagle. Instead of Houses and Hotels, set up Post Offices and Distribution Centers to move revenue, as Chance and Community Chest cards called Special Delivery and Rain Heat & Snow create detours.

Keep your assets in superb condition to stick it to the competition and win!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

boardgame.name: Battle for Carrion Vale
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This morning, the forces of Law and Chaos clashed at Castle Yennagor. The battle raged all day, but as darkness fell, a cataclysmic explosion destroyed most of the castle and leveled both armies.

Now, as night claims the vale, flickers of life return. Survivors make camp, flee the field, or continue the fight. Scavengers creep over the dead. And one question remains unanswered: what happened inside the castle?

This is a dark sandbox adventure. Players take the role of battlefield survivors. They can choose which side they are on (or neither), and they can choose their goal, such as to escape the field with their lives, to plunder the dead, or to reach the castle and finish the mission.

ADVENTURE TYPE: Mid Level / Combat / Diplomancy / Battlefield / War / Dark Fantasy / Factions

DESIGN NOTES

This adventure is intended for mid-level characters around Level 6-7
Players navigate a battlefield full of competing factions and gruesome situations
30 unique encounter locations
70+ original magic items
30+ original monsters
One map and multiple illustrations
Estimated play time: 1-4 sessions (4-16 hours)

boardgame.name: Wilderness Dressing: Woodlands (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of glossing over the details of your characters’ overland journey (except for the inevitable, violent random encounters)? Want to add minor features of interest to their journeys? Want to make their journeys seem more “real”?

Then Wilderness Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different type of wilderness and gives you--the busy GM--the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features, events and encounters. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, it is an invaluable addition to your GM's toolbox!

Wilderness Dressing: Woodlands presents:

Minor Events: One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your characters’ wilderness travel.
Minor Dressings: One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
Uneventful Day's Travel: One table (20 entries) presenting descriptions of uneventful days on the road.
Campsites: One table (20 entries) presenting campsites to add details to your characters' overnight wilderness trips.
Random Encounters: One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.

boardgame.name: Graveyard
boardgame.description:
The game perishes at an ancient graveyard, where an evil cardinal is awakened from the dead, and has cast his curse on the graveyard. A secret occult brotherhood has hired a bunch of explorers to have the curse lifted, and the cardinal sent back to the underworld. Occult priests will help you, under way, but are you strong enough in the belief that you can succeed, and if you have luck. The mission will not be easy, many explorers have entered the graveyard, but never come out again.
Now you and your friends get the chance to fight evil, dare to work together at the graveyard, knowing that you may not escape alive, and only one of you has the chance to win.
if you dare then let's play....

boardgame.name: NPC Almanac: The Register
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The NPC is an essential part of any role playing game and Castles & Crusades is no exception. NPCs play a variety of roles from the barkeep at the tavern that passes on juicy rumors for a few coins, to the well-paid henchmen who drags the wounded character to safety and healing.

The Register consists of a series of tables for scores of NPCs, both class based and hirelings, or adherents. These NPC entries include all the info you need to place the NPC in your game and begin play. They contain name, sex, appearance, personality, hook, alignment, level, BtH, HP, AC, Primary Attributes, Secondary Attributes, armor, weapons, and special info. With over 1200 NPCs presented; it is the perfect resource for your role playing game!

boardgame.name: NPC Almanac: Sketches
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The NPC is an essential part of any role playing game and Castles & Crusades is no exception. NPCs play a variety of roles from the barkeep at the tavern that passes on juicy rumors for a few coins, to the well-paid henchmen who drags the wounded character to safety and healing.

The Almanac consists of collections of long and short NPCs entries both class based and hirelings, or adherents. These NPC entries include all the info you need to place the NPC in your game and begin play. They contain name, name complete description, a little background, gender, appearance, personality, hook, alignment, and where called for level, BtH, HP, AC, Primary Attributes, Secondary Attributes, armor, weapons, and special info. With hundreds NPCs presented; it is the perfect resource for your role playing game!

boardgame.name: Moonflower (sapling edition)
boardgame.description:
A Story Game for Three Pilgrims

From the introduction:

an unbelievably long time ago, people who no longer live here used to live here. they loved the light of the sun. they could not stand to let a single ray leave them; they broke open their world and created a great sphere to envelop their sun entire. this garden must have filled with endless and flawless light and warmth. their garden must have overflown with beauty, filling the skies like the morning tide.

they could pluck worlds and prune stars, but they were not almighty. these people, who came before us, no longer live here.

but the garden was not abandoned. they hung a satellite around the orbit of the sun, where they could gaze and rejoice at its brilliance. none has been to the moon. yet, all say it is home to what the people who came before us left behind.
